dialogueTree.title: Volition: "Soft, light brown eyes look back at..."
dialogueTree.english: Soft, light brown eyes look back at you, directly into the space behind your eye sockets. You see the smoke rise from between her painted red lips. She's beautiful...
dialogueTree.polish: Łagodne, jasnobrązowe oczy odpowiadają swoim spojrzeniem na twoje – patrzą w głąb twoich oczodołów. Widzisz unoszący się spomiędzy jej naszminkowanych ust dym. Jest piękna...
dialogueTree.belarusian: Лагодныя, светла-карыя вочы адказваюць сваім позіркам на твае – глядзяць углыб тваіх вачніц. Ты бачыш дым, які ўзнімаецца з яе намаляваных вуснаў. Яна прыгожая...

links.title: Volition: "I have bad news for you."
links.english: I have bad news for you.
links.polish: Mam dla ciebie złe wieści.
links.belarusian: У мяне для цябе дрэнныя навіны.

links.title: You: "What?"
links.english: What?
links.polish: Jakie?
links.belarusian: Якія?

links.title: Volition: "You know these guys?"
links.english: You know these guys?
links.polish: Ty znasz tych tutaj?
links.belarusian: Ты ведаеш гэтых тут?

links.title: Logic: "Who, me?"
links.english: Who, me?
links.polish: Kogo, mnie?
links.belarusian: Каго, мяне?

links.title: Drama: "Yes, you. He's talking about you, y..."
links.english: Yes, you. He's talking about you, you boring stiff.
links.polish: Tak, ciebie. Mówi o tobie, nudny sztywniaku.
links.belarusian: Так, цябе. Кажа пра цябе, нудны зануда.

links.title: Volition: "You too."
links.english: You too.
links.polish: O tobie też.
links.belarusian: Пра цябе таксама.

links.title: Drama: "Me? What did I do? I'm merely a mas..."
links.english: Me? What did I do? I'm merely a master thespian...
links.polish: O mnie? A co ja robię? To li i jedynie mistrzostwo aktorstwa...
links.belarusian: Пра мяне? А што я раблю? Гэта толькі і выключна майстэрства акцёрскага мастацтва...

links.title: Volition: "These guys are compromised. She's g..."
links.english: These guys are compromised. She's got them singing along to her tune. The little bleeps and bloops you trust for info -- you can't trust them anymore.
links.polish: Zostali przekabaceni. Tańczą dokładnie tak, jak ona im zagra. Te plamki twojej świadomości, od których czerpiesz informacje... Nie możesz im już ufać.
links.belarusian: Яны былі падмануты. Яны танчаць так, як яна ім загадвае. Гэтыя плямы тваёй свядомасці, ад якіх ты чэрпаеш звесткі... Ты ўжо не можаш ім давяраць.

links.title: You: "Oh my god."
links.english: Oh my god.
links.polish: Mój boże.
links.belarusian: О мой Божа.

links.title: Volition: "Believe it."
links.english: Believe it.
links.polish: Naprawdę.
links.belarusian: Сапраўды.

links.title: You: "Which ones exactly are affected?"
links.english: Which ones exactly are affected?
links.polish: Kto z nich dokładnie został tym dotknięty?
links.belarusian: Хто з іх дакладна быў гэтым закрануты?

links.title: Volition: "There's no way of knowing. At the m..."
links.english: There's no way of knowing. At the moment I'm afraid it's best to assume...
links.polish: Nie sposób stwierdzić. Niestety, najrozsądniej będzie chyba po prostu zakładać...
links.belarusian: Немагчыма сцвярджаць. На жаль, верагодна, найбольш разумна будзе проста меркаваць...

links.title: Volition: "...*all* of them."
links.english: ...*all* of them.
links.polish: ...że *wszyscy*.
links.belarusian: ...што *ўсе*.

links.title: Electrochemistry: "Bullshit, man, I ain't *compromised..."
links.english: Bullshit, man, I ain't *compromised*.
links.polish: Co za pieprzenie. Nikt mnie nie *przekabacił*.
links.belarusian: Што за бздура. Ніхто мяне не *зводзіў*.

links.title: Volition: "*Especially* that guy. That guy's t..."
links.english: *Especially* that guy. That guy's the most compromised one in here.
links.polish: O, *zwłaszcza* ty. Najbardziej ze wszystkich.
links.belarusian: О, *асабліва* ты. Больш за ўсіх.

links.title: Electrochemistry: "No fucking way, man, I just want a..."
links.english: No fucking way, man, I just want a drag of that sweet Menthol ziggie.
links.polish: Ni chuja. Ja chcę tylko bucha tego mentolowego papieroska.
links.belarusian: Ні халеры. Я проста хачу толькі зацягнуцца гэтым ментолавым цыгарэтам.

links.title: Volition: "Really? Quick, tell me what's under..."
links.english: Really? Quick, tell me what's under her jumpsuit?
links.polish: Naprawdę? Szybko, powiedz, co jest pod tym jej kombinezonem!
links.belarusian: Сапраўды? Хутка, кажы, што пад гэтым яе камбінезонам!

links.title: Electrochemistry: "GLORY. TRUTH. SOFTNESS. PROTECT HER..."
links.english: GLORY. TRUTH. SOFTNESS. PROTECT HER. SHE WANTS YOU.
links.polish: CHWAŁA. PRAWDA. MIĘKKOŚĆ. CHROŃ JĄ. ONA CIĘ PRAGNIE.
links.belarusian: ХВАЛА. ПРАЎДА. МЯККАСЦЬ. АХОЎВАЙ ЯЕ. ЯНА ЦЯБЕ ЖАДАЕ.

links.title: Volition: "I take it back. He's got it pretty..."
links.english: I take it back. He's got it pretty bad, but this *next guy's* on another level entirely...
links.polish: Cofam to. Nie masz się najlepiej, ale spójrz na *ten* poziom przekabacenia:
links.belarusian: Адмаўляюся ад гэтага. Ты не ў найлепшым стане, але паглядзі на *гэты* ўзровень падману:

links.title: Suggestion: "She likes you. The Crownhead is a b..."
links.english: She likes you. The Crownhead is a boring condom. He's jealous. This is human nature.
links.polish: Podobasz jej się. Koronny łeb jest po prostu nudziarskim kondomem. Zazdrości. Taka już jest ludzka natura.
links.belarusian: Ты ёй падабаешся. Каронная галава проста нудны прэзерватыў. Рэўнасць. Такая ўжо чалавечая натура.

links.title: You: "How did this happen?"
links.english: How did this happen?
links.polish: Jak do tego doszło?
links.belarusian: Як гэта здарылася?

links.title: Volition: "How it always does -- through subtl..."
links.english: How it always does -- through subtlety.
links.polish: Tak jak zawsze – poprzez subtelność.
links.belarusian: Як заўсёды – праз далікатнасць.

links.title: You: "What can I do?"
links.english: What can I do?
links.polish: Co mogę zrobić?
links.belarusian: Што я магу зрабіць?

links.title: Volition: "There's nothing you can do about it..."
links.english: There's nothing you can do about it. You are how you are -- and she is how she is. Things will go as they do.
links.polish: Nic się na to nie poradzi. Jesteś, jaki jesteś. Ona też jest, jaka jest. Sprawy potoczą się tak, jak się potoczą.
links.belarusian: Нічога з гэтым не зробіш. Ты такі, які ты ёсць. Яна таксама такая, якая яна ёсць. Справы пойдуць так, як пойдуць.

links.title: You: "Can't you turn them normal again?"
links.english: Can't you turn them normal again?
links.polish: Nie możesz im przywrócić normalności?
links.belarusian: Ці не можаш ім вярнуць нармальнасць?

links.title: Volition: "No."
links.english: No.
links.polish: Nie.
links.belarusian: Не.

links.title: You: "What use is this then?"
links.english: What use is this then?
links.polish: To po co mi o tym mówisz?
links.belarusian: Навошта ты мне гэта кажаш?

links.title: Volition: "It's better to know you're being pl..."
links.english: It's better to know you're being played than to be played without knowing it, is it not?
links.polish: Lepiej wiedzieć, że ktoś z tobą pogrywa, niż po prostu dać się omamić, nieprawdaż?
links.belarusian: Лепш ведаць, што нехта з табой гуляе, чым проста даць сябе ашукаць, праўда?

links.title: You: "Does this mean she's been lying to..."
links.english: Does this mean she's been lying to me?
links.polish: Czy to znaczy, że byłem okłamywany?
links.belarusian: Ці гэта азначае, што мяне падманулі?

links.title: Volition: "Yes. Mr. Thespian here has been sin..."
links.english: Yes. Mr. Thespian here has been singing paeans to how truthful she is...
links.polish: Tak. Przecież słyszałeś te peany na cześć jej prawdomówności...
links.belarusian: Так. Бо ж ты чуў гэтыя пахвалы на яе праўдзівасць...

links.title: Drama: "She isth a laedy most fair and just..."
links.english: She isth a laedy most fair and juste!
links.polish: Toż jest to dama piękna i sprawiedliwa!
links.belarusian: Гэта ж жанчына прыгожая і справядлівая!

links.title: Volition: "In his defence -- to reduce him to..."
links.english: In his defence -- to reduce him to such inadequacy, she probably had to employ half-truths more often than outright lies.
links.polish: Na obronę dramaturgii – taka niekompetencja wymagała zapewne korzystania częściej z półprawd niż oczywistych kłamstw.
links.belarusian: На абарону драматургіі – такая некампетэнтнасць патрабавала, напэўна, выкарыстоўваць часцей паўпраўды, чым відавочныя хлусні.

links.title: Rhetoric: "That is correct. And omissions too."
links.english: That is correct. And omissions too.
links.polish: Zgadza się. A także z niedopowiedzeń.
links.belarusian: Сапраўды. А таксама з недаказанасцяў.

links.title: You: "Can I trust that guy?"
links.english: Can I trust that guy?
links.polish: A w to mogę uwierzyć?
links.belarusian: А ў гэта магу паверыць?

links.title: Volition: "A little. They're all still of limi..."
links.english: A little. They're all still of limited use, interpreting things to the best of their ability. Maybe they add flair or something? I wouldn't know. I don't add flair.
links.polish: W jakimś małym stopniu. Wszyscy z nich wciąż do czegoś się nadają, interpretują rzeczywistość najlepiej, jak tylko mogą. Może nadają jej jakiegoś smaku? Nie wiem. Ja smaku nie dodaję.
links.belarusian: У нейкай нязначнай ступені. Усе яны ўсё яшчэ на нешта здольныя, інтэрпрэтуюць рэчаіснасць найлепш, як толькі могуць. Можа, яны надаюць ёй нейкі смак? Не ведаю. Я не дадаю смака.

links.title: Volition: "But when it comes to assessments of..."
links.english: But when it comes to assessments of character and factual accuracy they are not to be trusted. Not with her.
links.polish: Ale jeśli chodzi o ocenę charakteru i trzeźwą analizę faktów, nie wolno im ufać. Nie w przypadku tej kobiety.
links.belarusian: Але калі гаворка ідзе пра ацэнку характару і цьвярозы аналіз фактаў, ім нельга давяраць. Не ў выпадку гэтай жанчыны.

links.title: You: "Can I trust any of them *ever again..."
links.english: Can I trust any of them *ever again?*
links.polish: A będę mógł im jeszcze *kiedykolwiek* zaufać?
links.belarusian: А ці змагу я ім яшчэ *калі-небудзь* давяраць?

links.title: Volition: "Don't be melodramatic. You can trus..."
links.english: Don't be melodramatic. You can trust them. Just not with *her*.
links.polish: Nie przesadzaj z tym melodramatyzmem. Możesz im ufać. Ale nie w *jej przypadku*.
links.belarusian: Не перабольшвай з гэтым меладраматызмам. Ты можаш ім давяраць. Але не ў *яе выпадку*.

Alternate1.english: Don't be melodramatic. You can trust them. Just not with Miss Oranje Disco Dancer here.
Alternate1.polish: Nie przesadzaj z tym melodramatyzmem. Możesz im ufać. Ale nie w przypadku tancerki disco i miss Oranje.
Alternate1.belarusian: Не перабольшвай з гэтым меладраматызмам. Ты можаш ім давяраць. Але не ў выпадку дыскатэчнай танцоркі і міс Аранжа.

links.title: Perception (Sight): "A light green speck, and imperfecti..."
links.english: A light green speck, and imperfection, on the outer rim of her right iris. It sparkles...
links.polish: Jasnozielona plamka, niedoskonałość na zewnętrznym brzegu jej prawej tęczówki. Połyskuje...
links.belarusian: Ясназялёная плямка, недасканаласць на знешнім краі яе правай вясёлкі. Блішчыць...

links.title: You: "Okay."
links.english: Okay.
links.polish: Dobra.
links.belarusian: Добра.

links.title: Volition: "Good. The less paranoid option. You..."
links.english: Good. The less paranoid option. You can trust them. Just not with *her*.
links.polish: Dobrze, to ta mniej paranoiczna opcja. Możesz im ufać. Ale nie w *jej przypadku*.
links.belarusian: Добра, гэта менш параноідальная опцыя. Ты можаш ім давяраць. Але не ў *яе выпадку*.

Alternate1.english: Good. The less paranoid option. You can trust them. Just not with Klaasje Amandou.
Alternate1.polish: Dobrze, to ta mniej paranoiczna opcja. Możesz im ufać. Ale nie w przypadku Klaasje Amandou.
Alternate1.belarusian: Добра, гэта менш параноідальная версія. Можаш ім давяраць. Але не ў выпадку з Класяй Амандаў.

links.title: Volition: "I think it's safe to assume: yes. M..."
links.english: I think it's safe to assume: yes. Mr. Thespian here hasn't been speaking up. If he were, I suspect there would be paeans to her truthfulness. Like this...
links.polish: Można chyba bezpiecznie założyć, że tak. Proszę, coś nie słyszymy żadnej teatralności. Ale gdybyśmy usłyszeli, z pewnością byłby to pean na cześć prawdomówności dziewczyny. O taki...
links.belarusian: Можна, напэўна, з упэўненасцю меркаваць, што так. Калі ласка, мы нічога не чуем пра ніякія тэатральнасці. Але калі б пачулі, то несумненна быў бы гэта панегырык на гонар праўдзівасці дзяўчыны. Вось такі...

links.title: Drama: "She isth a laedy most fair and just..."
links.english: She isth a laedy most fair and juste!
links.polish: Toż jest to dama piękna i sprawiedliwa!
links.belarusian: Таму гэта дама прыгожая і справядлівая!

links.title: Volition: "...no? He's not going to show up? I..."
links.english: ...no? He's not going to show up? I'm sorry, your lie detection isn't working. It's not her doing, he's just totally inept. It looks like you're also an idiot. But that's not her fault.
links.polish: ...nie? Nie pojawi się? Przykro mi, twój wykrywacz kłamstw nie działa. To niczyja wina, jest po prostu kompletnie nieudolny. Wygląda na to, że jesteś też przy tym idiotą. Ale to nie wina tej kobiety.
links.belarusian: ...не? Не з'явіцца? Шкада, твой дэтэктар хлусні не працуе. Гэта не чыясь віна, ён проста цалкам неэфектыўны. Выглядае на тое, што ты таксама пры гэтым дурань. Але гэта не віна гэтай жанчыны.

links.title: Empathy: "No, not an idiot. You're just more..."
links.english: No, not an idiot. You're just more of a *sensitive* type. Thinks with his *heart*. This woman's *pain* draws you in.
links.polish: Nie, nie idiotą. Jesteś po prostu bardziej *wrażliwcem*. Myślisz raczej *sercem*. *Ból* tej kobiety cię przyciąga.
links.belarusian: Не, не ідыёт. Ты проста больш *уразлівы*. Ты думаеш хутчэй *сэрцам*. *Боль* гэтай жанчыны цябе прыцягвае.

links.title: You: "What is her *plan*?"
links.english: What is her *plan*?
links.polish: Jaki ona ma *plan*?
links.belarusian: Які ў яе *план*?

links.title: Volition: "You can't draw a sound conclusion...."
links.english: You can't draw a sound conclusion. The one who usually does says...
links.polish: Nie umiesz wysnuć przekonującego wniosku. Ale czekaj, jest ktoś, kto zawsze to robi.
links.belarusian: Вы не ўмееце зрабіць пераканаўчую выснову. Але пачакайце, ёсць хтосьці, хто заўсёды гэта робіць.

links.title: Logic: "She may want to control the informa..."
links.english: She may want to control the information roll-out -- not to become a suspect. She may have a past she's escaping, unrelated to this case. You doubt it's something truly insidious.
links.polish: Może chcieć kontrolować przepływ informacji tak, aby nie stać się podejrzaną. Może mieć w swojej przeszłości jakąś niepowiązaną ze sprawą ucieczkę. Nie wydaje ci się, żeby było to coś prawdziwie podstępnego.
links.belarusian: Можа жадаць кантраляваць паток інфармацыі, каб не стаць падазронай. Можа мець у сваёй мінуўшчыне нейкае непасрэдна не звязанае са справай ўцёкі. Не здаецца табе, каб гэта было нешта сапраўды падступнае.

links.title: Volition: "See? It's oddly moderate. Probably..."
links.english: See? It's oddly moderate. Probably compromised.
links.polish: Widzisz? To takie zaskakująco umiarkowane. Przekabacenie jak nic.
links.belarusian: Бачыш? Гэта такое дзіўна ўмеранае. Перакрыць як нічога.

links.title: Half Light: "You are *not* afraid. This is a mer..."
links.english: You are *not* afraid. This is a mere girl, she was someone's child but a decade ago.
links.polish: *Nie boisz* się. To zwykła dziewczyna, ledwie dekadę temu była czyimś dzieckiem.
links.belarusian: *Не баішся* яе. Гэта звычайная дзяўчына, усяго дзесяць гадоў таму яна яшчэ была чыімсьці дзіцем.

links.title: Reaction Speed: "...nothing? Someone else was suppos..."
links.english: ...nothing? Someone else was supposed to chime in, weren't they? And then they didn't -- just me swooshing around in here now. Swoosh!
links.polish: ...i tyle? Ktoś chyba powinien tu coś wtrącić, prawda? A jednak nie wtrącił. Tylko ja tu teraz śmigam. Śmig!
links.belarusian: ...і ўсё? Нехта, напэўна, павінен тут нешта ўставіць, праўда? Але ж не ўставіў. Толькі я тут зараз лётаю. Лёц!

links.title: Volition: "Huh... no, Mr. Conclusion. You're a..."
links.english: Huh... no, Mr. Conclusion. You're always kind of limited in your analytical abilities. That's not *her* fault. But still...
links.polish: Hę? Nie, panie Wnioskujący. Zawsze masz dość ograniczone umiejętności analityczne. To nie *jej* wina. Ale mimo wszystko...
links.belarusian: Га? Не, пане Заяўніку. У вас заўсёды даволі абмежаваныя аналітычныя здольнасці. Гэта не *яе* віна. Але ўсё ж...

links.title: You: "I've been talking to myself long en..."
links.english: I've been talking to myself long enough. Let's get back to it.
links.polish: Wystarczająco już długo gadam sam ze sobą. Wróćmy do rzeczy.
links.belarusian: Дастаткова ўжо доўга размаўляю сам з сабой. Вярнуся да справы.

links.title: Volition: "Don't worry, it's only been four or..."
links.english: Don't worry, it's only been four or five seconds. You've got this.
links.polish: Bez obaw, minęło ledwie pięć czy sześć sekund. Nie ma się czym martwić.
links.belarusian: Не хвалюйцеся, прайшло ўсяго пяць ці шэсць секунд. Няма нагоды для турботы.

links.title: You: "(Say it out loud.) "Miss, are you m..."
links.english: (Say it out loud.) "Miss, are you manipulating me?"
links.polish: (Powiedz to głośno). „Czy pani mną manipuluje?”
links.belarusian: "Ці вы мной маніпулюеце?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): "The silence broken, she exhales a l..."
links.english: The silence broken, she exhales a little cloud of smoke and says...
links.polish: Cisza została przerwana. Wydycha niewielki obłok dymu i mówi...
links.belarusian: Цішыня была парушаная. Ён выпускае невялікую воблаку дыму і кажа...

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""God, no!""
links.english: "God, no!"
links.polish: „Broń noże!”
links.belarusian: "Абараняць ножы!"

links.title: You: "(Don't say anything.) Just close yo..."
links.english: (Don't say anything.) Just close your eyes and let the moment pass.
links.polish: (Nic nie mów). Zamknij po prostu oczy i pozwól chwili przeminąć.
links.belarusian: (Нічога не кажы). Проста заплюшчы вочы і дазволь моманту прайсці.

links.title: Volition: "For a second her face disappears fr..."
links.english: For a second her face disappears from your cornea. Only a silvery negative remains.
links.polish: Jej twarz na moment znika z rogówek twoich oczu. Pozostaje po niej tylko srebrzysty negatyw.
links.belarusian: Яе твар на момант знікае з рагавічак тваіх вачэй. Застаецца пасля яе толькі серабрысты негатыў.

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): "Still smiling a tired smile."
links.english: Still smiling a tired smile.
links.polish: Wciąż ma na twarzy zmęczony uśmiech.
links.belarusian: Ён усё яшчэ мае на твары стомленую ўсмешку.

links.title: You: "What?"
links.english: What?
links.polish: Co?
links.belarusian: Што?

links.title: You: "I knew something was off..."
links.english: I knew something was off...
links.polish: Wiedziałem, że coś jest nie tak...
links.belarusian: Я ведаў, што нешта не так...

links.title: Volition: "I'm sorry I didn't catch it sooner...."
links.english: I'm sorry I didn't catch it sooner. It takes conscious effort on your part.
links.polish: Przepraszam, że nie udało mi się wyłapać tego szybciej. Potrzebny był świadomy wysiłek z twojej strony.
links.belarusian: Прабач, што мне не ўдалося зразумець гэта раней. Патрэбнае было свядомае намаганне з твайго боку.

links.title: Suggestion: "Who, me?"
links.english: Who, me?
links.polish: Kogo, mnie?
links.belarusian: Каго, мяне?

links.title: Authority: "Yes, you. He's talking about you, y..."
links.english: Yes, you. He's talking about you, you grovelling sycophant.
links.polish: Tak, ciebie. Mówi o tobie, żałosny lizusie.
links.belarusian: Так, цябе. Гаворыць пра цябе, жаласны лізун.

links.title: Volition: "You too."
links.english: You too.
links.polish: O tobie też.
links.belarusian: Пра цябе таксама.

links.title: Authority: "Me? Get outta here, I'm solid."
links.english: Me? Get outta here, I'm solid.
links.polish: O mnie? Won ode mnie, jestem w porządku.
links.belarusian: Пра мяне? Прэч ад мяне, я ў парадку.

links.title: Physical Instrument: "Who, me?"
links.english: Who, me?
links.polish: Kogo, mnie?
links.belarusian: Каго, мяне?

links.title: Electrochemistry: "Yes, he's talking about you, you si..."
links.english: Yes, he's talking about you, you sinewy idiot.
links.polish: Tak, ciebie. Mówi o tobie, żylasty przygłupie.
links.belarusian: Так, цябе. Гаворыць пра цябе, жыласты прыдурку.

links.title: Volition: "You too."
links.english: You too.
links.polish: O tobie też.
links.belarusian: Пра цябе таксама.

links.title: Electrochemistry: "Me? What have I done this time?"
links.english: Me? What have I done this time?
links.polish: O mnie? A co ja znowu źle robię?
links.belarusian: Пра мяне? А што я зноў раблю няправільна?

links.title: Reaction Speed: "Who, me?"
links.english: Who, me?
links.polish: Kogo, mnie?
links.belarusian: Кога, мяне?

links.title: Composure: "Yes, he's talking about you, you sh..."
links.english: Yes, he's talking about you, you shifty asshole.
links.polish: Tak, mówi o tobie, szemrana mendo.
links.belarusian: Так, кажа пра цябе, сумнеўная мэнда.

links.title: Volition: "You too."
links.english: You too.
links.polish: O tobie też.
links.belarusian: Пра цябе таксама.

links.title: Composure: "Me? No way, I'm straight, man."
links.english: Me? No way, I'm straight, man.
links.polish: O mnie? Niemożliwe, ja jestem w porządku.
links.belarusian: Пра мяне? Неверагодна, я ў парадку.

links.title: Logic: "Who, me?"
links.english: Who, me?
links.polish: Kogo, mnie?
links.belarusian: Каго, мяне?

links.title: Drama: "Yes, you. He's talking about you, y..."
links.english: Yes, you. He's talking about you, you boring stiff.
links.polish: Tak, ciebie. Mówi o tobie, nudny sztywniaku.
links.belarusian: Так, цябе. Кажа пра цябе, нудны зануда.

links.title: Volition: "You too."
links.english: You too.
links.polish: O tobie też.
links.belarusian: Пра цябе таксама.

links.title: Drama: "Me? What did I do?"
links.english: Me? What did I do?
links.polish: O mnie? A co ja robię?
links.belarusian: Пра мяне? А што я раблю?

dialogueTree.title: Volition: "Just like the last time, light brow..."
dialogueTree.english: Just like the last time, light brown eyes look back at you. All is as it was, you feel cigarette fumes rise from her lips. She's just as beautiful...
dialogueTree.polish: Tak jak poprzednio, odpowiada ci spojrzenie jasnobrązowych oczu. Wszystko jest tak jak poprzednio, czujesz unoszący się spomiędzy jej ust dym papierosowy. Jest tak samo piękna...
dialogueTree.belarusian: Як і раней, табе адказвае позірк светла-карычневых вачэй. Усё як раней, ты адчуваеш, як з яе вуснаў падымаецца дым цыгарэты. Яна такая ж прыгожая...

links.title: Suggestion: "Don't worry. We will protect you fr..."
links.english: Don't worry. We will protect you from her beauty. We will *consult* you through the reefs and sounds of her persona.
links.polish: Bez obaw. Obronimy cię przed jej pięknem. Dzięki naszym *radom* przebrniesz przez rafy i mielizny jej osobowości.
links.belarusian: Не хвалюйся. Мы абаронім цябе ад яе прыгажосці. Дзякуючы нашым *парадам* ты пераадолееў рыфы і мельнякі яе асобы.

links.title: Drama: "We will see through deceits. You ar..."
links.english: We will see through deceits. You are shielded. You are wise.
links.polish: Przejrzymy jej podstępy. Jesteś chroniony. Jesteś mądry.
links.belarusian: Разгледзім яе хітрыкі. Ты абаронены. Ты мудры.

links.title: Electrochemistry: "You are advised. There are muscles..."
links.english: You are advised. There are muscles on long white bones that line her limbs, just below the silver jumpsuit...
links.polish: Będziemy ci doradzać. Wzdłuż długich, białych kości jej kończyn, zaraz pod srebrnym kombinezonem, biegną mięśnie...
links.belarusian: Мы будзем табе раіць. Уздоўж доўгіх, белых касцей яе канечнасцяў, адразу пад срэбным камбінезонам, цягнуцца мышцы...

links.title: Savoir Faire: "Miss Oranje Disco Dancer... You wan..."
links.english: Miss Oranje Disco Dancer... You want to put your hand on her back and feel it arch.
links.polish: Tancerka disco i miss Oranje... Chciałbyś położyć rękę na jej plecach, poczuć ich łuk.
links.belarusian: Танцоўшчыца дыскатэкі і міс Оранж... Хацеў бы пакласці руку ёй на спіну, адчуць іх выгнутасць.

links.title: You: "What is... happening?"
links.english: What is... happening?
links.polish: Co się... dzieje?
links.belarusian: Што адбываецца?

links.title: Conceptualization: "Nothing. Just time passing. Don't w..."
links.english: Nothing. Just time passing. Don't worry.
links.polish: Nic. Po prostu mija czas. Bez obaw.
links.belarusian: Нічога. Проста ідзе час. Без турбот.

links.title: Authority: "You are not a *fool*."
links.english: You are not a *fool*.
links.polish: Nie jesteś *durniem*.
links.belarusian: Вы не *дурны*.

links.title: Perception (Sight): "Anything out of the ordinary and yo..."
links.english: Anything out of the ordinary and you would be notified.
links.polish: Gdyby działo się cokolwiek nietypowego, powiedzielibyśmy ci.
links.belarusian: Каб было што-небудзь незвычайнае, мы б табе сказалі.

links.title: Endurance: "Air moves in your windpipe. Your he..."
links.english: Air moves in your windpipe. Your heart beats. You're a detective -- get back to detecting.
links.polish: W tchawicy płynie powietrze. Twoje serce bije. Jesteś detektywem. Więc wracaj do śledztwa.
links.belarusian: У трахеі цячэ паветра. Тваё сэрца б'ецца. Ты дэтэктыў. Таму вяртайся да расследавання.

links.title: You: "Am I being... beguiled?"
links.english: Am I being... beguiled?
links.polish: Czy ja padam ofiarą... uroku?
links.belarusian: Ці я становяцца ахвярай... чараў?

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): "She presses her elbows against her..."
links.english: She presses her elbows against her waist and slowly turns her head.
links.polish: Przyciska łokcie do talii i powoli obraca głowę.
links.belarusian: Цісне локці да пояса і павольна паварочвае галаву.

links.title: Perception (Hearing): "Her hair brushes her shoulders, mak..."
links.english: Her hair brushes her shoulders, making a small hissing sound, almost imperceptible...
links.polish: Włosy ocierają jej się o ramiona, wydając cichy, syczący, niemal niesłyszalny odgłos...
links.belarusian: Валасы датыкаюцца да яе плячэй, выдаючы ціхі, шыпячы, амаль нячутны гук...

links.title: You: "Avert your eyes."
links.english: Avert your eyes.
links.polish: Odwróć wzrok.
links.belarusian: Адверні вачэй.

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): "The strange moment ends. It was bri..."
links.english: The strange moment ends. It was brief, no longer than 2.2 seconds.
links.polish: Ta dziwna chwila dobiega końca. Nie trwała długo, nie dłużej niż 2,2 sekundy.
links.belarusian: Гэта дзіўная хвіліна заканчваецца. Не працягвалася доўга, не даўжэй чым 2,2 секунды.

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Serious..." She takes a long, hard..."
links.english: "Serious..." She takes a long, hard drag of her cigarette, then stretches her neck.
links.polish: „Poważnej...” – zaciąga się głęboko, po czym rozprostowuje szyję.
links.belarusian: "Сур'ёзнай..." – глыбока ўдыхае, затым выпрастаўшы шыю.

links.title: Perception (Hearing): "You hear cracking in her shoulders."
links.english: You hear cracking in her shoulders.
links.polish: Słyszysz, jak strzelają jej stawy w ramionach.
links.belarusian: Вы чуеце, як трэскаюцца яе суставы ў плячах.

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Let me make this 100% clear then,..."
links.english: "Let me make this 100% clear then, officer. I was not sexually assaulted. Would I be this flippant if I had been?"
links.polish: „Dobrze, powiem tak, żeby nie było wątpliwości. Nie padłam ofiarą napaści seksualnej. Czy w przeciwnym razie zachowywałabym się równie beztrosko?”
links.belarusian: "Добра, скажу так, каб не было сумневаў. Я не стала ахвярай сэксуальнага нападу. Ці паводзіла б я сябе настолькі бязладна ў адваротным выпадку?"

links.title: Electrochemistry: "You get the feeling she's done enou..."
links.english: You get the feeling she's done enough opiates -- and needed enough NACRA -- to still be flippant if her arm were cut off and fed to her.
links.polish: Masz przeczucie, że zażyła dość opiatów – i potrzebowała dość NACRY – żeby być beztroską nawet, gdyby odcięli jej ramię i kazali jej je zjeść.
links.belarusian: У цябе ёсць адчуванне, што яна прыняла дастаткова опіатаў – і ёй спатрэбілася досыць НАЦРЫ – каб быць бесклапотнай нават, калі б адрэзалі ёй руку і прымусілі яе есці.

links.title: You: ""Titus asked you to spice things up..."
links.english: "Titus asked you to spice things up -- for us?"
links.polish: „Titus prosił, żeby dodała pani dla nas pikanterii sprawie?”
links.belarusian: "Ці прасіў Цітус, каб вы дабавілі для нас вострасці ў справе?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Pretty much." She cradles her coff..."
links.english: "Pretty much." She cradles her coffee cup in both hands.
links.polish: „Tak mniej więcej było” – kołysze kubek z kawą w obu dłoniach.
links.belarusian: "Так прыблізна і было", — пагойдвала кубак з кавай у абедзвюх руках.

links.title: Interfacing: "Warming them."
links.english: Warming them.
links.polish: Ogrzewając je.
links.belarusian: Падаграваючы іх.

links.title: Endurance: "She must be very cold. And exhauste..."
links.english: She must be very cold. And exhausted of this life.
links.polish: Musi być bardzo zmarznięta. I wyczerpana tym życiem.
links.belarusian: Яна, напэўна, вельмі змерзлая. І змучаная гэтым жыццём.

links.title: Savoir Faire: "Warming up your hands relieves stre..."
links.english: Warming up your hands relieves stress and anxiety, makes you feel and appear calmer, more comfortable. Seems she's doing that here -- consciously or not.
links.polish: Ogrzewanie dłoni niweluje stres i niepokój, sprawia, że czujesz się i wyglądasz spokojniej, lepiej. Zdaje się, że to właśnie ma na celu, świadomie czy nie.
links.belarusian: Награванне рук зніжае стрэс і трывогу, робіць, што вы адчуваеце сябе і выглядаеце спакайней, лепш. Здаецца, што гэта менавіта тое, для чаго гэта прызначана, свядома ці не.

links.title: You: ""Are you sure you weren't raped?""
links.english: "Are you sure you weren't raped?"
links.polish: „Na pewno nie została pani zgwałcona?”
links.belarusian: "Вы ўпэўнены, што не былі згвалтаваныя?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""I'm 89% sure.""
links.english: "I'm 89% sure."
links.polish: „Tak na 89%”.
links.belarusian: "Так на 89%".

links.title: You: ""So you're not entirely sure?""
links.english: "So you're not entirely sure?"
links.polish: „A więc nie jest pani całkowicie pewna?”
links.belarusian: "Такім чынам, вы не цалкам упэўнены?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""You know how it is.""
links.english: "You know how it is."
links.polish: „Wie pan, jak to jest”.
links.belarusian: "Ведаеце, як гэта бывае".

links.title: Half Light: "You *do* know how it is."
links.english: You *do* know how it is.
links.polish: *Wiesz*, jak to jest.
links.belarusian: *Ведаеш*, як гэта.

links.title: You: ""Do I?""
links.english: "Do I?"
links.polish: „Wiem?”
links.belarusian: "Ведаю?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Hmh..." She flicks a bit of ash aw..."
links.english: "Hmh..." She flicks a bit of ash away. "Maybe you don't..." The ash lands on her jumpsuit. She brushes it off.
links.polish: „Hm...” – strząsa odrobinę popiołu. „Może i nie...” – popiół spada na jej kombinezon. Strzepuje go.
links.belarusian: "Хм..." — змахвае крыху попелу. "Можа і не..." — попел падае на яе касцюм. Яна змахвае яго.

links.title: Perception (Sight): "There are numerous cigarette burns..."
links.english: There are numerous cigarette burns on those silvery scales -- easy to see now that you're closer.
links.polish: Srebrzyste łuski są w wielu miejscach przypalone papierosem. Teraz, kiedy jesteś bliżej, łatwo to zauważyć.
links.belarusian: Срэбраныя лускі ў шматлікіх месцах прыгарэлі цыгарэтай. Цяпер, калі вы бліжэй, лёгка гэта заўважыць.

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""In conclusion, officer -- I'm gonn..."
links.english: "In conclusion, officer -- I'm gonna go with a mild to medium *not raped* here."
links.polish: „Podsumowując, wybieram wersję umiarkowanego *braku gwałtu*”.
links.belarusian: "Падсумоўваючы, я выбіраю версію ўмеранага *адсутнасці гвалту*".

links.title: You: ""Okay then.""
links.english: "Okay then."
links.polish: „No dobrze”.
links.belarusian: "Ну добра".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): "She takes a long, hard drag of her..."
links.english: She takes a long, hard drag of her cigarette, then stretches her neck.
links.polish: Zaciąga się głęboko, po czym rozprostowuje szyję.
links.belarusian: Глыбей удыхае, потым выпрастае шыю.

links.title: Perception (Hearing): "You hear cracking in her shoulders."
links.english: You hear cracking in her shoulders.
links.polish: Słyszysz, jak strzelają jej stawy w ramionach.
links.belarusian: Ты чуеш, як страляюць яе суставы ў руках.

links.title: You: ""No one deserves to be raped.""
links.english: "No one deserves to be raped."
links.polish: „Nikt nie zasługuje na gwałt”.
links.belarusian: "Ніхто не заслугоўвае згвалтавання".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""I'm sure there's *one* person in t..."
links.english: "I'm sure there's *one* person in the world who does." A crooked smile. "I mean, there are *so many* people. But let me make this clear: The man in that tree did not rape me."
links.polish: „Jestem pewna, że gdzieś jest choć *jedna* taka osoba” – pojawia się skrzywiony uśmieszek. „W końcu na świecie żyje *tak wielu* ludzi. Ale żeby było jasne: ten mężczyzna na drzewie mnie nie zgwałcił”.
links.belarusian: "Я ўпэўнена, што дзесьці ёсць хаця б *адзін* такі чалавек" — з'яўляецца скрыўленая ўсмешка. "Урэшце рэшт, на свеце жыве *так шмат* людзей. Але каб было ясна: гэты мужчына на дрэве мяне не згвалціў".

Alternate1.english: "I'm sure there's *one* person in the world who does." A crooked smile. "I mean there are *so many* people. But let me make this clear: The man who was hanged from that tree did not rape me."
Alternate1.polish: „Jestem pewna, że gdzieś jest choć *jedna* taka osoba” – pojawia się skrzywiony uśmieszek. „W końcu na świecie żyje *tak wielu* ludzi. Ale żeby było jasne: ten powieszony na drzewie mężczyzna mnie nie zgwałcił”.
Alternate1.belarusian: "Я ўпэўнена, што недзе ёсць хаця б *адзін* такі чалавек", — з'яўляецца скрыўленая ўсмешка. "У рэшце рэшт, на свеце жыве *так шмат* людзей. Але каб было ясна: гэты павешаны на дрэве мужчына мяне не згвалціў".

links.title: Rhetoric: "The wording -- a verbal eye roll. S..."
links.english: The wording -- a verbal eye roll. She's almost disgusted with the platitude you served up.
links.polish: Sposób, w jaki to powiedziała, stanowi coś w rodzaju werbalnego przewrócenia oczami. Jest niemalże zdegustowana frazesem, którym rzuciłeś.
links.belarusian: Спосаб, у які яна гэта сказала, уяўляе сабой нешта накшталт вербальнага перакочвання вачэй. Яна амаль што абураная фразай, якую ты кінуў.

links.title: You: ""Sexual assault is a serious matter..."
links.english: "Sexual assault is a serious matter. I need a serious statement from you."
links.polish: „Napaść seksualna to poważna sprawa. Więc potrzebuję z pani strony poważnej deklaracji”.
links.belarusian: "Сексуальнае напружанне — гэта сур'ёзная справа. Таму мне патрэбна ад вас сур'ёзная заява".

links.title: You: ""It sounds like something happened,..."
links.english: "It sounds like something happened, and you don't want to acknowledge it."
links.polish: „Brzmi to, jakby do czegoś doszło, ale nie chciała pani tego powiedzieć głośno”.
links.belarusian: "Гэта гучыць, быццам нешта здарылася, але вы не хочаце казаць пра гэта ўслых".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Let me make this 100% clear then,..."
links.english: "Let me make this 100% clear then, officer. I was not sexually assaulted." She tilts her head. "Would I be as flippant if I had been?"
links.polish: „Dobrze, powiem tak, żeby nie było wątpliwości. Nie padłam ofiarą napaści seksualnej” – przekrzywia głowę. „Czy w przeciwnym razie zachowywałabym się tak beztrosko?”
links.belarusian: "Добра, скажу так, каб не было сумневаў. Я не стала ахвярай сэксуальнага гвалту", — згінае галаву. "Ці паводзіла б я сябе так бесклапотна ў адваротным выпадку?"

links.title: You: ""Lieutenant, I don't know what to s..."
links.english: "Lieutenant, I don't know what to say about this."
links.polish: „Poruczniku, nie wiem, co mogę o tym powiedzieć”.
links.belarusian: "Лейтэнант, не ведаю, што магу пра гэта сказаць".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I'm sorry, miss, but we need a def..."
links.english: "I'm sorry, miss, but we need a definite statement."
links.polish: „Przykro mi, ale potrzebujemy jasnego oświadczenia”.
links.belarusian: "Шкада, але нам патрэбна ясная заява".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Let me make this 100% clear then,..."
links.english: "Let me make this 100% clear then, officers. I was not sexually assaulted. Would I be this flippant if I had been?"
links.polish: „Dobrze, panowie, powiem tak, żeby nie było wątpliwości. Nie padłam ofiarą napaści seksualnej. Czy w przeciwnym razie zachowywałabym się równie beztrosko?”
links.belarusian: "Добра, спадары, скажу так, каб не было сумневаў. Я не стала ахвярай сэксуальнага нападу. Ці паводзіла б я сябе ў адваротным выпадку так жа бестурботна?"

links.title: You: ""Actually I don't.""
links.english: "Actually I don't."
links.polish: „Właściwie to nie wiem”.
links.belarusian: "Сапраўды, я не ведаю".

links.title: You: ""I may.""
links.english: "I may."
links.polish: „Może i tak”.
links.belarusian: "Можа і так".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Sure you do, you disco animal..."..."
links.english: "Sure you do, you disco animal..." She cuts you down to size with her light brown eyes.
links.polish: „No pewnie, że tak, ty discobestio ty...” – zbija cię z pantałyku swoimi jasnobrązowymi oczami.
links.belarusian: "Ну вядома, што так, ты дыскатэчная бестыя ты..." — збівае цябе з панталыку сваімі светла-карычневымі вачыма.

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Sure you do, apocalypse cop..." Sh..."
links.english: "Sure you do, apocalypse cop..." She cuts you down to size with her light brown eyes.
links.polish: „No pewnie, że tak, apokaliptyczny glino...” – zbija cię z pantałyku swoimi jasnobrązowymi oczami.
links.belarusian: "Вядома, што так, апакаліптычны паліцэйскі..." — злазіць цябе з панталыку сваімі светла-карычневымі вачыма.

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Sure you do, detective..." She cut..."
links.english: "Sure you do, detective..." She cuts you down to size with her light brown eyes.
links.polish: „No pewnie, że tak, detektywie...” – zbija cię z pantałyku swoimi jasnobrązowymi oczami.
links.belarusian: "Ну, вядома, так, дэтэктыў..." — збівае цябе з панталыку сваімі светла-карычневымі вачыма.

links.title: You: ""I do.""
links.english: "I do."
links.polish: „Wiem”.
links.belarusian: "Ведаю".

links.title: You: ""How is it then?""
links.english: "How is it then?"
links.polish: „Więc jak jest?”
links.belarusian: "Дык як там?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Hmh..." She flicks a bit of ash aw..."
links.english: "Hmh..." She flicks a bit of ash away. "Maybe you *don't* know." The ash lands on her jumpsuit. She brushes it off.
links.polish: „Hm...” – strząsa odrobinę popiołu. „Może jednak pan *nie* wie” – popiół spada na jej kombinezon. Strzepuje go.
links.belarusian: "Хм..." – страсае крышачку попелу. "Магчыма, аднак, вы *не* ведаеце" – попел падае на ейны камбінезон. Яна страсая яго.

links.title: Half Light: "You *may* know..."
links.english: You *may* know...
links.polish: *Może* i wiesz.
links.belarusian: *Можа* і ведаеш.

links.title: Half Light: "Do you?"
links.english: Do you?
links.polish: Czy aby na pewno?
links.belarusian: Ці сапраўды?

links.title: You: ""Does that mean you're 11% not sure?""
links.english: "Does that mean you're 11% not sure?"
links.polish: „Czy to znaczy, że jest pani na 11% niepewna?”
links.belarusian: "Ці гэта значыць, што вы на 11% няўпэўнены?"

links.title: You: ""Got it. 89% is good enough. Moving..."
links.english: "Got it. 89% is good enough. Moving on."
links.polish: „Rozumiem. 89% wystarczy. Przejdźmy dalej”.
links.belarusian: "Разумею. 89% дастаткова. Пераходзім далей".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Cool.""
links.english: "Cool."
links.polish: „Czad”.
links.belarusian: "Клас".

links.title: Empathy: "She sincerely thinks it's very cool..."
links.english: She sincerely thinks it's very cool of you.
links.polish: Szczerze uważa, że to z twojej strony czadowe.
links.belarusian: Шчыра лічыць, што гэта з твайго боку класна.

links.title: You: ""What *did* happen between you and..."
links.english: "What *did* happen between you and the victim?"
links.polish: „A co *zaszło* między panią a ofiarą?”
links.belarusian: "А што *адбылося* паміж вамі і ахвярай?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""We partied.""
links.english: "We partied."
links.polish: „Imprezowaliśmy razem”.
links.belarusian: "Мы разам весяліліся".

links.title: You: ""Wait... *partied*. Where have I he..."
links.english: "Wait... *partied*. Where have I heard that before?"
links.polish: „Zaraz... *Imprezowaliście*. Gdzie ja to wcześniej słyszałem?”
links.belarusian: "Зараз... *Вы вечарынкавалі*. Дзе я гэта раней чуў?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""A lot of partying going on.""
links.english: "A lot of partying going on."
links.polish: „Imprezowanie jest dość powszechne”.
links.belarusian: "Вечарыны з'яўляюцца даволі распаўсюджанымі".

links.title: Reaction Speed: "From Titus. About her and Titus' re..."
links.english: From Titus. About her and Titus' relationship -- that's where you heard it.
links.polish: Od Titusa. Rozmawialiście o stosunkach między nimi. Tam to wcześniej słyszałeś.
links.belarusian: Ад Цітуса. Вы размаўлялі аб адносінах паміж імі. Там ты гэта раней чуў.

links.title: You: ""You mean like a birthday party?""
links.english: "You mean like a birthday party?"
links.polish: „W sensie jak na imprezie urodzinowej?”
links.belarusian: "У сэнсе як на дні нараджэння?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Yes." She makes a twisting motion..."
links.english: "Yes." She makes a twisting motion with her hands. "We made balloon animals, drank lemonade, inflated a bouncy castle."
links.polish: „Tak” – wykonuje dłońmi gest skręcania: „Robiliśmy zwierzątka z baloników, piliśmy lemoniadę, a potem skakaliśmy na dmuchanym zamku”.
links.belarusian: "Так" – робіць рукамі жэст кручэння: "Мы рабілі жыўёлак з балонікаў, пілі ліманад, а потым скакалі на надзіманым замку".

links.title: You: ""Did you rim the lemonade glasses w..."
links.english: "Did you rim the lemonade glasses with sugar? I like to do that."
links.polish: „A cukrowaliście brzegi szklanek z lemoniadą? Lubię tak robić”.
links.belarusian: "А саладзілі вы краі шклянак з ліманадам? Мне падабаецца так рабіць".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Yeah, I love that too!" Her voice..."
links.english: "Yeah, I love that too!" Her voice is girlishly high-pitched now. "We frosted the glasses, I unwrapped my bike, there was a petting zoo with little white rabbits..."
links.polish: „Tak, też to uwielbiam!” – jej głos jest teraz wysoki i dziewczęcy. „Pocukrzyliśmy szklanki, odpakowałam rower... I można było pogłaskać takie białe króliczki...”
links.belarusian: "Так, я таксама гэта абажаю!" – яе голас цяпер высокі і дзяўчынкавы. "Мы падсаладзілі шклянкі, я распакавалі ровар... І можна было пагладзіць такіх белых трусянят..."

links.title: You: ""Really?""
links.english: "Really?"
links.polish: „Naprawdę?”
links.belarusian: "Сапраўды?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""I would like it to have been that..."
links.english: "I would like it to have been that way. But... it wasn't."
links.polish: „Chciałabym, żeby tak to wyglądało. Ale... nie wyglądało”.
links.belarusian: "Я хацела б, каб так гэта выглядала. Але... не выглядала".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""How was it?""
links.english: "How was it?"
links.polish: „A jak wyglądało?”
links.belarusian: "А як гэта выглядала?"

links.title: You: ""How was it?""
links.english: "How was it?"
links.polish: „A jak wyglądało?”
links.belarusian: "А як гэта выглядала?"

links.title: You: ""You're being sarcastic. That's not..."
links.english: "You're being sarcastic. That's not actually how you partied."
links.polish: „Ironizuje pani. Nie tak imprezowaliście”.
links.belarusian: "Іранізуеце спадарыня. Не так святкавалі".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""It's not, sir. We drank alcohol. A..."
links.english: "It's not, sir. We drank alcohol. A lot of it. We had that effect on each other -- made each other drink harder."
links.polish: „Nie, nie imprezowaliśmy tak. Piliśmy alkohol. W dużych ilościach. Tak już na siebie działaliśmy – wzajemnie motywowaliśmy się do picia”.
links.belarusian: "Не, мы не вражылі так. Пілі алкаголь. У вялікіх колькасцях. Мы так на сябе ўздзейнічалі – узаемна матывавалі адзін аднаго піць".

links.title: You: ""What kind of partying?" (Point to..."
links.english: "What kind of partying?" (Point to your bloated face.) "The kind I do?"
links.polish: „Jak imprezowaliście? Tak jak ja?” (Wskaż swoją opuchniętą twarz).
links.belarusian: "Як весяліліся? Так, як я?" (Пакажыце свой апухлы твар).

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""With all due respect, sir, I think..."
links.english: "With all due respect, sir, I think we partied a little harder than that."
links.polish: „Z całym szacunkiem do pana możliwości, imprezowaliśmy chyba nieco ostrzej”.
links.belarusian: "З усёй павагай да вашых магчымасцей, здаецца, мы трохі больш шчыра весяліліся".

links.title: You: ""*No one* parties harder than me.""
links.english: "*No one* parties harder than me."
links.polish: „*Nikt* nie imprezuje ostrzej niż ja”.
links.belarusian: "*Ніхто* не весяліцца больш бурна, чым я".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Please, you're alive and *fifty*!..."
links.english: "Please, you're alive and *fifty*! I've known people who party so hard they're dead at 14..." She stops to take a short drag.
links.polish: „Błagam, pan nadal żyje w wieku *pięćdziesięciu* lat! Znałam ludzi, którzy imprezowali tak ostro, że zeszli przed 15 rokiem życia...” – przerywa, żeby zaciągnąć się płytko papierosem.
links.belarusian: "Малю, пан усё яшчэ жыве ва ўзросце *пяцідзесяці* гадоў! Я ведала людзей, якія так моцна гулялі, што памерлі да 15 гадоў..." – спыняецца, каб паверхнева зацягнуцца цыгарэтай.

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""What no one does *on your level* i..."
links.english: "What no one does *on your level* is hitting the repeat button, I'll give you that. And *maybe* room-trashing."
links.polish: „Ale muszę przyznać, że *na pańskim poziomie* nie wciska się zwykle zapętlenia. No i *może* nie wywraca się pokoju do góry nogami”.
links.belarusian: "Але мушу прызнаць, што *на вашым узроўні* звычайна не ўстаўляецца зацыкленне. Ну і *магчыма* не пераварочваецца пакой уверх нагамі".

links.title: You: ""Harder than this?" (Keep pointing..."
links.english: "Harder than this?" (Keep pointing to your face.) "I didn't know it was physically possible."
links.polish: (Wskazuj dalej swoją twarz). „Ostrzej niż to? Nie sądziłem, że to fizycznie możliwe”.
links.belarusian: (Працягвай паказваць на сваё твар). "Больш рэзка, чым гэта? Я не думаў, што гэта фізічна магчыма".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Oh, it is." She takes a long drag...."
links.english: "Oh, it is." She takes a long drag. "You're still *alive*."
links.polish: „Ależ jak najbardziej” – zamyka wargi na papierosie i trwa tak przez chwilę. „Pan w końcu nadal *żyje*”.
links.belarusian: "Але ж як найбольш" — закрывае вусны на цыгарэце і застаецца так на хвіліну. "Спадар, урэшце, усё яшчэ *жыве*".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""What did you do? When you *partied..."
links.english: "What did you do? When you *partied*?"
links.polish: „Co robiliście? Podczas *imprezowania*?”
links.belarusian: "Што вы рабілі? Падчас *вечарыны*?"

links.title: You: ""What did you do? During these part..."
links.english: "What did you do? During these parties."
links.polish: „Co robiliście? Podczas tych imprez, znaczy”.
links.belarusian: "Што вы рабілі? На гэтых вечарынах, маю на ўвазе".

links.title: You: ""I don't get it. What do you mean *..."
links.english: "I don't get it. What do you mean *partied*?"
links.polish: „Nie rozumiem. Jak to *imprezowaliście*?”
links.belarusian: "Не разумею. Як гэта *вечарынкавалі*?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""We drank, sir..." She takes a sip..."
links.english: "We drank, sir..." She takes a sip of her coffee. "A lot. For weeks basically. We had that effect on each other -- we made each other drink harder. That's why I liked him."
links.polish: „Piliśmy, proszę pana...” – wlewa w siebie odrobinę kawy. „Intensywnie. Praktycznie całymi tygodniami. Tak już na siebie działaliśmy – wzajemnie motywowaliśmy się do picia. Dlatego go lubiłam”.
links.belarusian: "Пілі, пане..." – улівае ў сябе трохі кавы. "Інтэнсіўна. Практычна цэлымі тыднямі. Так ужо на сябе дзейнічалі – узаемна матывавалі да пітва. Таму я яго і любіла".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""What else?""
links.english: "What else?"
links.polish: „Co jeszcze?”
links.belarusian: "Што яшчэ?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Stimulants. Speed also has that ef..."
links.english: "Stimulants. Speed also has that effect -- making you drink harder. And then drinking harder makes you do more speed. It's quite the combination. We also had sex."
links.polish: „Stymulanty. Speed działa podobnie – popycha do picia więcej i więcej. A im więcej pijesz, tym chętniej sięgasz po speed. Takie zgrabne połączenie. Uprawialiśmy też seks”.
links.belarusian: "Стыгмулятары. Speed дзейнічае аналагічна — штурхае піць усё больш і больш. А чым больш п'еш, тым ахвотней цягнецца рука да speed. Такое акуратнае спалучэнне. Мы таксама займаліся сэксам".

links.title: Endurance: "Whoah. After so much drinking *and*..."
links.english: Whoah. After so much drinking *and* drugs -- how did they manage it?
links.polish: O rany. Po takim piciu *i* ćpaniu... Jak im się to udało?
links.belarusian: Ой-ой. Пасля такога піцця *і* наркотыкаў... Як ім гэта ўдалося?

links.title: You: ""Hold on. After so much drinking an..."
links.english: "Hold on. After so much drinking and drugs... *how?*"
links.polish: „Zaraz. Po takim piciu i ćpaniu... *Jak*?”
links.belarusian: "Зараз. Пасля такога п"янства і наркаманыі... *Як*?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""*Untraditionally*, officer." She p..."
links.english: "*Untraditionally*, officer." She puts out her Astra, but lights another one with its end first.
links.polish: „*Niekonwencjonalnie*, panie mundurowy” – gasi astrę, ale wcześniej odpala od niego kolejnego papierosa.
links.belarusian: "*Некамвэнцыянальна*, пане паліцэйскі", – гасіць астру, але раней запальвае ад яго яшчэ адну цыгарэту.

links.title: Electrochemistry: "She's cold and strange. I'm not pic..."
links.english: She's cold and strange. I'm not picking anything up here.
links.polish: Jest dziwna i zimna. Niczego nie wyczuwam.
links.belarusian: Яна дзіўная і халодная. Я нічога не адчуваю.

links.title: Inland Empire: "Your imagination starts whirring, w..."
links.english: Your imagination starts whirring, whether you want it to or not.
links.polish: Chcesz czy nie, twoja wyobraźnia wchodzi na wysokie obroty.
links.belarusian: Хочаш ты ці не, твая ўяўленне ўваходзіць на высокія абароты.

links.title: You: ""You were lovers?""
links.english: "You were lovers?"
links.polish: „Byliście kochankami?”
links.belarusian: "Былі вы палюбоўнікамі?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""I guess you can say that, yes. A b..."
links.english: "I guess you can say that, yes. A bit. Lovers is such an emotional word. But there was something there. We did enough drugs for there to be."
links.polish: „Chyba można tak powiedzieć. Trochę tak. Ale »kochankowie« to takie nacechowane uczuciowo słowo. Coś tam jednak między nami było. Zapewnił to odpowiedni zapas prochów”.
links.belarusian: "Мабыць, можна так сказаць. Трохі так. Але "каханкі" — гэта такое эмацыйна афарбаванае слова. Нешта ўсё ж было паміж намі. Забяспечыў гэта адпаведны запас парахоў".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""How did you two meet?" The lieuten..."
links.english: "How did you two meet?" The lieutenant's voice is quiet, calm.
links.polish: „Jak się poznaliście?” – głos porucznika jest cichy i spokojny.
links.belarusian: "Як вы пазнаёміліся?" — голас лейтэнанта ціхі і спакойны.

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Downstairs." She taps on the roof..."
links.english: "Downstairs." She taps on the roof with her 10 cm heel. "At the bar. He was on some sort of assignment -- a military man, as you probably know. Had a cool, scary scar."
links.polish: „Na dole” – stuka w dach swoim 10-centymetrowym obcasem. „W barze. To był wojskowy, jak pewnie pan wie, i wykonywał tu jakieś zadanie. Miał zarąbistą, przerażającą bliznę”.
links.belarusian: "Унізе" — стукае па даху сваім 10-сантыметровым абцасам. "У бары. Гэта быў вайсковец, як напэўна вы ведаеце, і выконваў тут нейкае заданне. У яго быў жудасны, страшны шнар".

links.title: Suggestion: "She appears aloof, but that scar pa..."
links.english: She appears aloof, but that scar part... the *scary* is stressed and drawn out. What's that about? Apprehension?
links.polish: Wydaje się być powściągliwa, ale to o bliźnie... Zaakcentowała i przeciągnęła słowo *przerażającą*. Co to było? Jakaś obawa?
links.belarusian: Здаецца, яна была стрыманай, але гэта наконт шнара… Яна падкрэсліла і выцягнула слова *жудасны*. Што гэта было? Якісь страх?

links.title: Empathy: "With longing. She misses him."
links.english: With longing. She misses him.
links.polish: To tęsknota. Brakuje jej go.
links.belarusian: Гэта настальгія. Яе не хапае яго.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""When was this?""
links.english: "When was this?"
links.polish: „Kiedy to było?”
links.belarusian: "Калі гэта было?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""A month ago? Something like that.""
links.english: "A month ago? Something like that."
links.polish: „Miesiąc temu? Coś koło tego”.
links.belarusian: "Месяц таму? Прыкладна так".

links.title: You: ""How long ago was that?""
links.english: "How long ago was that?"
links.polish: „Kiedy to było?”
links.belarusian: "Калі гэта было?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""About a month? Something like that.""
links.english: "About a month? Something like that."
links.polish: „Miesiąc temu? Jakoś tak”.
links.belarusian: "Месяц таму? Нешта такое".

links.title: You: ""How did you meet?""
links.english: "How did you meet?"
links.polish: „Jak się poznaliście?”
links.belarusian: "Як вы пазнаёміліся?"

links.title: You: ""Were feelings involved?""
links.english: "Were feelings involved?"
links.polish: „W grę wchodziły jakieś uczucia?”
links.belarusian: "Ці мелі месца нейкія пачуцці?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""A little. The drugs were good enou..."
links.english: "A little. The drugs were good enough -- and we did enough of them."
links.polish: „W pewnym stopniu. Zestaw prochów był wystarczająco dobry i mieliśmy ich pod dostatkiem”.
links.belarusian: "У пэўнай ступені. Набор пораху быў дастатковы добры, і яго ў нас было дастаткова".

links.title: You: ""Understood.""
links.english: "Understood."
links.polish: „Rozumiem”.
links.belarusian: "Разумею".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Mhm." She looks down at the yard."
links.english: "Mhm." She looks down at the yard.
links.polish: „Mhm” – spogląda w dół na podwórze.
links.belarusian: "Мгм" — глядзіць уніз на двор.

links.title: You: ""What else?""
links.english: "What else?"
links.polish: „Co jeszcze?”
links.belarusian: "Што яшчэ?"

links.title: You: ""Suspect partied with victim. Write..."
links.english: "Suspect partied with victim. Write it down, Kim."
links.polish: „Podejrzana imprezowała z ofiarą. Zapisz to, Kim”.
links.belarusian: "Падазраваная весялілася з ахвярай. Запішы гэта, Кім".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You're being sarcastic.""
links.english: "You're being sarcastic."
links.polish: „Wyczuwam sarkazm”.
links.belarusian: "Адчуваю сарказм".

links.title: You: ""I am. Care to elaborate, miss?""
links.english: "I am. Care to elaborate, miss?"
links.polish: „Słusznie. Zechce pani rozwinąć?”
links.belarusian: "Слушна. Не маглі б вы патлумачыць?"

links.title: You: ""No, I'm literally satisfied with t..."
links.english: "No, I'm literally satisfied with that answer."
links.polish: „Nie, jestem zupełnie dosłownie usatysfakcjonowany tą odpowiedzią”.
links.belarusian: "Не, я цалкам літаральна задаволены гэтым адказам".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I'm not." He turns to the woman. "..."
links.english: "I'm not." He turns to the woman. "What was your relationship with the man they hanged?"
links.polish: „A ja nie” – zwraca się do kobiety: „Co łączyło panią z mężczyzną, który został powieszony?”
links.belarusian: "А я не", — звяртаецца да жанчыны: "Што звязвала вас з мужчынам, які быў павешаны?"

links.title: You: ""It must be hard..." (Point to the..."
links.english: "It must be hard..." (Point to the yard.) "Seeing him there."
links.polish: „Musi być trudno widzieć go tam na dole”. (Wskaż podwórze).
links.belarusian: "Мусіць, цяжка бачыць яго там унізе". (Пакажыце на двор).

Alternate1.english: "It must have been hard for you..." (Point to the yard.) "Seeing him there."
Alternate1.polish: „To musiało być dla pani trudne”. (Wskaż podwórze). „Ciągle go widzieć tam na dole”.
Alternate1.belarusian: "Гэта мусіла быць для вас цяжка". (Пакажыце на двор). "Увесь час яго бачыць там унізе".

Alternate2.english: "It must have been hard for you..." (Point to the yard.) "Seeing him there."
Alternate2.polish: „To musiało być dla pani trudne”. (Wskaż podwórze). „Ciągle go widzieć tam na dole”.
Alternate2.belarusian: "Гэта, напэўна, было для вас цяжка". (Паказвае на двор). "Усё бачыць яго там унізе".

Alternate3.english: "It must be hard for you..." (Point to the yard.) "Seeing him there all the time."
Alternate3.polish: „Musi być dla pani trudno widzieć go tam przez cały czas”. (Wskaż podwórze).
Alternate3.belarusian: "Напэўна, вам цяжка бачыць яго там увесь час". (Пакажыце двара).

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Oh yes," she says bitterly. "I've..."
links.english: "Oh yes," she says bitterly. "I've had a great view. From the roof, out of the bathroom window. In my dreams..."
links.polish: „O tak” – odpowiada cierpko. „Miałam piękny widok. Z dachu, z okna łazienki. W moich snach...”
links.belarusian: "О так", — адказвае саркастычна. "Я мела цудоўны выгляд. З даху, з акна ваннай. У маіх снах..."

links.title: Pain Threshold: "A bitter cringe. It *hurts*. You lo..."
links.english: A bitter cringe. It *hurts*. You look to the lieutenant...
links.polish: Wzdraga się z goryczą. To *ból*. Spoglądasz na porucznika...
links.belarusian: Ён здрыгаецца з горыччу. Гэта *боль*. Ты глядзіш на лейтэнанта...

links.title: Composure: "He takes a small step closer."
links.english: He takes a small step closer.
links.polish: Podchodzi mały krok bliżej.
links.belarusian: Падыходзіць на маленькі крок бліжэй.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You called us. The RCM...""
links.english: "You called us. The RCM..."
links.polish: „Wezwała nas pani. MOR...”
links.belarusian: "Вы нас выклікалі. РГМ..."

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Yes.""
links.english: "Yes."
links.polish: „Tak”.
links.belarusian: "Так".

links.title: Logic: "Jackpot!"
links.english: Jackpot!
links.polish: Bank rozbity!
links.belarusian: Банк разбіты!

links.title: You: ""The call -- reporting the hanging?..."
links.english: "The call -- reporting the hanging? That was you?"
links.polish: „Telefon. Zgłoszenie o powieszeniu. To była pani?”
links.belarusian: "Тэлефон. Паведамленне пра павешанне. Гэта былі вы?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""I made it." She nods. "And I would..."
links.english: "I made it." She nods. "And I would appreciate it if you didn't tell everyone. In Martinaise they call it *snitching*."
links.polish: „Ja was wezwałam” – potwierdza skinieniem. „I prosiłabym, żeby to zostało między nami. W Martinaise nazywają to *kablowaniem*”.
links.belarusian: "Я вас выклікала", — пацвярджае яна кіўком. "І прасіла б, каб гэта засталося паміж намі. У Мартынайзе гэта называюць *даванне паказанняў*".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Reporting crimes is confidential i..."
links.english: "Reporting crimes is confidential in Revachol, miss."
links.polish: „Zgłoszenia przestępstw są w Revacholu objęte tajemnicą”.
links.belarusian: "Заявы аб злачынствах у Рэвашолі знаходзяцца пад таямніцай".

links.title: You: ""Before we go on -- if it's *snitch..."
links.english: "Before we go on -- if it's *snitching* then why do it?"
links.polish: „Zanim przejdziemy dalej – skoro to *kablowanie*, to czemu to pani zrobiła?”
links.belarusian: "Перш чым пяройдзем далей — калі гэта *кабеляванне*, то чаму вы гэта зрабілі?"

Alternate1.polish: „Skoro to *kablowanie*, to czemu to pani zrobiła?”
Alternate1.belarusian: "Калі гэта *кляўзніца*, чаму ж вы гэта зрабілі?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Because I couldn't *handle* it any..."
links.english: "Because I couldn't *handle* it anymore." She takes a drag -- her voice thick with disgust. "None of these people called. He just kept hanging there. Then they started stripping him..."
links.polish: „Bo nie mogłam już tego *znieść*” – zaciąga się, a jej głos ocieka odrazą. „Nikt inny nie zadzwonił, kiedy tak tam wisiał. Potem zaczęli go ogołacać...”
links.belarusian: "Бо я больш не магла гэтага *трываць*", — кажа яна, а яе голас прасякнуты адчуваннем агіды. "Ніхто іншы не патэлефанаваў, калі ён там так вісеў. Потым пачалі яго абкрадваць..."

links.title: Empathy: "Tearing off his armour, demeaning h..."
links.english: Tearing off his armour, demeaning him, throwing rocks at him...
links.polish: Zdzierać z niego pancerz, bezcześcić, rzucać kamieniami...
links.belarusian: Здзіраць з яго панцыр, ганьбіць, кідаць камянямі...

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""The voice was disguised," he asks,..."
links.english: "The voice was disguised," he asks, clearly wishing to distract her from the images. "Did you?..."
links.polish: „Głos zgłaszającej osoby był zmieniony” – stwierdza porucznik, najwyraźniej próbując sprawić, by przestała skupiać się na przykrych wspomnieniach. „Czy zmodyfikowała go pani?”
links.belarusian: "Голас чалавека, які паведаміў, быў зменены", – сцвярджае лейтэнант, відавочна спрабуючы зрабіць так, каб яна перастала засяроджвацца на непрыемных успамінах. "Ці змянялі вы яго?"

links.title: You: ""The caller's voice was disguised.""
links.english: "The caller's voice was disguised."
links.polish: „Głos osoby dzwoniącej był zmodyfikowany”.
links.belarusian: "Голас чалавека, які званіў, быў змадэляваны".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""I didn't exactly *disguise* it. I..."
links.english: "I didn't exactly *disguise* it. I just muffled the mic and nicked the landline a little."
links.polish: „Trudno to nazwać *modyfikacją*. Wyciszyłam tylko mikrofon i ciachnęłam trochę linię”.
links.belarusian: "Цяжка гэта назваць *мадзіфікацыяй*. Я толькі заглушыла мікрафон і трохі падрэзала лінію".

links.title: You: ""Nicked it -- how?""
links.english: "Nicked it -- how?"
links.polish: „Ciachnęła pani...? Jak?”
links.belarusian: "Цягнула пані...? Як?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""With nail clippers. And I diverted..."
links.english: "With nail clippers. And I diverted some radio fuzz into it. Into the cold wire."
links.polish: „Cążkami do paznokci. I przekierowałam do niej trochę szumu. Do zimnego kabla”.
links.belarusian: "Кусачкамі для пазногцяў. І перанакіравала да яе трохі шуму. Да халоднага кабеля".

links.title: Logic: "So *she's* Garte's mystery phone cu..."
links.english: So *she's* Garte's mystery phone cutter!
links.polish: A więc to *ona* jest tajemniczą telefoniczną sabotażystką Garte'a!
links.belarusian: Дык, гэта *яна* з'яўляецца таемнай тэлефоннай дыверсанцкай Гарте!

links.title: You: ""And, in the process, you broke the..."
links.english: "And, in the process, you broke the landline downstairs."
links.polish: „I przy okazji uszkodziła pani linię telefoniczną na dole”.
links.belarusian: "І заадно пашкодзілі вы тэлефонную лінію ўнізе".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Did I?" She looks into her coffee...."
links.english: "Did I?" She looks into her coffee. "Fuck. I didn't mean to. I had no idea what I was doing."
links.polish: „Naprawdę?” – spogląda w czarną otchłań swej kawy. „Kurwa. To niechcący. Nie miałam pojęcia, co robię”.
links.belarusian: "Сапраўды?" — глядзіць у чорную бездань сваёй кавы. "Чорт. Гэта было выпадкова. Я не мела паняцця, што раблю".

links.title: Logic: "Jigsaw falling into place. This is..."
links.english: Jigsaw falling into place. This is satisfying. Good catch, I appreciate the symmetry.
links.polish: Element układanki trafia na swoje miejsce. Satysfakcjonujące. Dobrze wyłapane, podoba mi się ta symetria.
links.belarusian: Элемент галаваломкі становіцца на сваё месца. Здаволенасць. Добра злоўлена, падабаецца мне гэтая сіметрыя.

links.title: Volition: "You should be wary of what this guy..."
links.english: You should be wary of what this guy likes. He's easily duped by his love of jigsaw puzzles.
links.polish: Powinieneś uważać na to, co mu się podoba. Łatwo go podejść przez zamiłowanie do układanek i łamigłówek.
links.belarusian: Вы павінны звярнуць увагу на тое, што яму падабаецца. Лёгка падысці да яго праз захапленне галаваломкамі і галаваломкамі.

links.title: Interfacing: "Still, that's pretty clever tamperi..."
links.english: Still, that's pretty clever tampering. Simple and clever, crossing the lines like that.
links.polish: Niemniej to było naprawdę sprytne. Proste i zmyślne, tak połączyć sygnały.
links.belarusian: Тым не менш, гэта было сапраўды хітра. Простае і кемлівае, так злучыць сігналы.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Which landline?""
links.english: "Which landline?"
links.polish: „Którą linię?”
links.belarusian: "Якую лінію?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""The one downstairs, officer. I use..."
links.english: "The one downstairs, officer. I used the Whirling landline."
links.polish: „Tę na dole. Użyłam linii Whirling”.
links.belarusian: "Тую ўнізе. Я выкарыстала лініі Whirling".

links.title: Interfacing: "That's some clever tampering. Simpl..."
links.english: That's some clever tampering. Simple and clever, crossing the lines like that.
links.polish: To było naprawdę sprytne. Proste i zmyślne, tak połączyć sygnały.
links.belarusian: Гэта было сапраўды хітра. Проста і мудра спалучыць сігналы.

links.title: You: ""Seems like you had *some* idea. Th..."
links.english: "Seems like you had *some* idea. That was nifty."
links.polish: „*Jakieś* pojęcie chyba pani miała. To było sprytne”.
links.belarusian: "Нейкае" паняцце, мабыць, у пані было. Гэта было хітра.

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Thanks." She manages a smile."
links.english: "Thanks." She manages a smile.
links.polish: „Dzięki” – zdobywa się na uśmiech.
links.belarusian: "Дзякуй" – усміхнуўся.

links.title: Drama: "She looks a bit like a little girl..."
links.english: She looks a bit like a little girl who's just been complimented on her bike repair skills.
links.polish: Wygląda trochę jak mała dziewczynka, którą ktoś pochwalił, bo naprawiła sobie rower.
links.belarusian: Выглядае трохі як маленькая дзяўчынка, якую нехта пахваліў, бо яна сама адрамантавала сабе ровар.

links.title: You: "Don't mention it."
links.english: Don't mention it.
links.polish: Nie wspominaj o tym.
links.belarusian: Не згадвай пра гэта.

links.title: Interfacing: "She must have had training of some..."
links.english: She must have had training of some kind...
links.polish: Musiała zostać jakoś przeszkolona...
links.belarusian: Яна, напэўна, мусіла прайсці нейкае навучанне...

links.title: You: ""Why go through all the trouble?""
links.english: "Why go through all the trouble?"
links.polish: „Po co robić sobie tyle kłopotu?”
links.belarusian: "Навошта столькі турботы?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""I don't know, sir. It was stupid...."
links.english: "I don't know, sir. It was stupid. I was drunk too. I was *probably* afraid the Union was listening in -- locals say they have ears in the wires."
links.polish: „Nie wiem, to było głupie. A ja byłam nieźle zrobiona. *Chyba* pomyślałam, że Związek może podsłuchiwać – mówi się, że są podłączeni do linii”.
links.belarusian: "Не ведаю, гэта было глупства. А я была досыць п'яная. *Мабыць,* я падумала, што Звяз можа падслухоўваць – кажуць, што яны падключаны да лініі".

links.title: Drama: "We're not *entirely* convinced abou..."
links.english: We're not *entirely* convinced about that answer, but okay -- let it slide. Pushing won't help here.
links.polish: Nie przekonuje nas ta odpowiedź *tak do końca*, ale dobrze – niech będzie. Naciskanie nic tu nie pomoże.
links.belarusian: Нас не пераконвае гэты адказ *да канца*, але добра – няхай будзе так. Ціснуць тут нічога не дапаможа.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Thank you for making the call, mis..."
links.english: "Thank you for making the call, miss. It was the right thing to do."
links.polish: „Dziękujemy za dokonanie tego zgłoszenia. Postąpiła pani słusznie”.
links.belarusian: "Дзякуем за падачу гэтай заяўкі. Вы паступілі правільна".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""I didn't want to, sir. But if I ha..."
links.english: "I didn't want to, sir. But if I hadn't, he'd *still* be hanging there..."
links.polish: „Wcale tego nie chciałam. Ale gdyby nie to, wisiałby tam *do teraz*...”
links.belarusian: "Я зусім гэтага не хацела. Але калі б не гэта, ён бы вісеў там *да гэтага часу*..."

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""I didn't want to, sir. But if I ha..."
links.english: "I didn't want to, sir. But if I hadn't, he'd *still* be hanging there..." She looks away.
links.polish: „Wcale tego nie chciałam. Ale gdyby nie to, wisiałby tam *do teraz*...” – odwraca wzrok.
links.belarusian: "Увогуле гэтага не хацела. Але калі б не гэта, ён вісеў бы там *да гэтага часу*... " — адвярнула погляд.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""He won't be down there long, miss...."
links.english: "He won't be down there long, miss. We will move the body to the morgue soon."
links.polish: „Nie pozostanie tam długo. Wkrótce przeniesiemy jego ciało do kostnicy”.
links.belarusian: "Ён не застанецца там доўга. Хутка мы перавязём яго цела ў морг".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""I didn't want to, sir. And he's *s..."
links.english: "I didn't want to, sir. And he's *still* hanging there..." She looks away.
links.polish: „Wcale tego nie chciałam. A on *wciąż* tam wisi...” – odwraca wzrok.
links.belarusian: "Я зусім гэтага не хацела. А ён *усё яшчэ* там вісіць..." – адвярнула позірк.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""We will move the body to the morgu..."
links.english: "We will move the body to the morgue today, miss. Don't worry."
links.polish: „Jeszcze dziś przeniesiemy jego ciało do kostnicy. Proszę się tym nie martwić”.
links.belarusian: "Яшчэ сёння мы перанясём яго цела ў морг. Калі ласка, не турбуйцеся пра гэта".

links.title: You: ""Well, thank you for making the cal..."
links.english: "Well, thank you for making the call anyway."
links.polish: „Tak czy inaczej, dziękuję za dokonanie tego zgłoszenia”.
links.belarusian: "Так ці інакш, дзякуй за зробленае гэта паведамленне".

links.title: You: ""At least you called.""
links.english: "At least you called."
links.polish: „Przynajmniej to pani zgłosiła”.
links.belarusian: "Па меншай меры, вы гэта паведамілі".

links.title: You: ""A risky move, altogether.""
links.english: "A risky move, altogether."
links.polish: „Ogólnie rzecz biorąc, to był ryzykowny ruch”.
links.belarusian: "Увогуле кажучы, гэта быў рызыкоўны крок".

links.title: Logic: "You were right to suspect there mig..."
links.english: You were right to suspect there might be foul play involved with the broken phone line!
links.polish: Słusznie podejrzewałeś, że za uszkodzeniem linii telefonicznej może kryć się czyjś występek!
links.belarusian: Вы слушна падазравалі, што за пашкоджаннем тэлефоннай лініі можа хавацца чыёсьці правіннасць!

links.title: Logic: "So that's why the phone is out of o..."
links.english: So that's why the phone is out of order. She tampered with the Whirling landline!
links.polish: A więc to dlatego telefon nie działa. Grzebała przy linii w Whirling!
links.belarusian: Вось чаму тэлефон не працуе. Яна капалася ў лініі ў Whirling!

links.title: You: ""What do you mean?""
links.english: "What do you mean?"
links.polish: „Co chce pani przez to powiedzieć?”
links.belarusian: "Што вы хочаце гэтым сказаць?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""I made the call. And I would appre..."
links.english: "I made the call. And I would appreciate it if you didn't tell everyone. In Martinaise they call it *snitching*."
links.polish: „Ja dokonałam zgłoszenia. I prosiłabym, żeby to zostało między nami. W Martinaise nazywają to *kablowaniem*”.
links.belarusian: "Я зрабіла паведамленне. І я прасіла б, каб гэта засталося паміж намі. У Мартынайзе гэта называюць *кабляннем*".

links.title: You: "Say nothing."
links.english: Say nothing.
links.polish: Nic nie mów.
links.belarusian: Нічога не кажы.

links.title: Pain Threshold: "A bitter cringe. It hurts her."
links.english: A bitter cringe. It hurts her.
links.polish: Wzdraga się z goryczą. To dla niej ból.
links.belarusian: Страшна з горыччу. Гэта для яе боль.

links.title: Empathy: "You wonder... is it enough to..."
links.english: You wonder... is it enough to...
links.polish: Zastanawiasz się... Czy to wystarczy, żeby...
links.belarusian: Цікавішся... Ці дастаткова гэтага, каб...

links.title: You: ""Did you make the call?""
links.english: "Did you make the call?"
links.polish: „Czy to pani dokonała zgłoszenia?”
links.belarusian: "Ці гэта вы зрабілі заяўку?"

links.title: You: "Don't say it."
links.english: Don't say it.
links.polish: Nie mów tego.
links.belarusian: Не кажы гэтага.

links.title: Empathy: "She hunches her shoulders a bit, ma..."
links.english: She hunches her shoulders a bit, making herself smaller.
links.polish: Garbi się nieco, przez co wydaje się niższa.
links.belarusian: Трохі ссутулена, з-за чаго здаецца ніжэйшай.

links.title: Empathy: "It hurts her. But does it hurt enou..."
links.english: It hurts her. But does it hurt enough to...
links.polish: Boli ją to. Ale czy wystarczająco, żeby...
links.belarusian: Яе гэта балела. Але ці дастаткова, каб...

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Oh yes," she says bitterly. "I hav..."
links.english: "Oh yes," she says bitterly. "I have *multiple* viewpoints. From the roof, out of the bathroom window. In my dreams..."
links.polish: „O tak” – odpowiada cierpko. „Mam *kilka* punktów obserwacyjnych. Z dachu, z okna łazienki. W moich snach...”
links.belarusian: "О так", — адказвае ён з горыччу. "Маю *некалькі* пунктаў назірання. З даху, з акна ваннай. У маіх снах..."

links.title: You: ""What can you tell me about him. Na..."
links.english: "What can you tell me about him. Name, eyes, age..."
links.polish: „Co może mi pani o nim powiedzieć? Imię, kolor oczu, wiek...”
links.belarusian: "Што можаце мне пра яго расказаць? Імя, колер вачэй, узрост..."

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""I'm sorry, I can't do it." She puf..."
links.english: "I'm sorry, I can't do it." She puffs on her cigarette. "Not right now. Later maybe. I keep seeing him. Like he is now. I can't talk about his -- I don't know -- *hair...*" Another puff, more nervous.
links.polish: „Przepraszam, nie mogę” – zaciąga się krótko papierosem. „Nie teraz. Może później. Ciągle go widzę. To, co się z nim stało. Nie potrafię tak po prostu rozmawiać o jego... nie wiem... *włosach*” – wciąga dym raz jeszcze, bardziej nerwowo.
links.belarusian: "Прабачце, не магу", — каротка зацягваецца цыгарэтай. "Не зараз. Можа, пазней. Я ўсё яшчэ бачу яго. Гэта, што з ім здарылася. Не магу так проста гаварыць пра ягоныя... не ведаю... *валасы*", — яшчэ раз неўраўнаважана зацягваецца дымам.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I know it's difficult, miss. We ca..."
links.english: "I know it's difficult, miss. We can return to it later."
links.polish: „Wiem, że to dla pani trudne. Możemy wrócić do tego później”.
links.belarusian: "Ведаю, што гэта для вас цяжка. Можам вярнуцца да гэтага пазней".

links.title: Inland Empire: "She meant she sees him in her dream..."
links.english: She meant she sees him in her dreams.
links.polish: Chce powiedzieć, że widzi go w swoich snach.
links.belarusian: Хачу сказаць, што бачыць яго ў сваіх снах.

links.title: You: ""I've also seen him in a dream.""
links.english: "I've also seen him in a dream."
links.polish: „Ja też go widziałem we śnie”.
links.belarusian: "Я таксама яго бачыў ва сне".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""You have? Not like I do, I imagine..."
links.english: "You have? Not like I do, I imagine." She's run out of cigarette -- time to light a new one.
links.polish: „Naprawdę? Ale pewnie nie tak jak ja” – kończy jej się papieros, czas zapalić kolejnego.
links.belarusian: "Сапраўды? Але, напэўна, не так, як я", — заканчваецца яе цыгарэта, час закурыць яшчэ адну.

links.title: Electrochemistry: "She sees them in each other's arms."
links.english: She sees them in each other's arms.
links.polish: Widzi siebie w jego objęciach.
links.belarusian: Бачыць сябе ў яго абдымках.

links.title: You: ""You're in each other's arms.""
links.english: "You're in each other's arms."
links.polish: „Trzymacie się w objęciach”.
links.belarusian: "Вы трымаецеся ў абдымках".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Yes. And then he's dead. His mouth..."
links.english: "Yes. And then he's dead. His mouth agape..." She looks into the light green pack of cigarettes and pulls out another one, preparing to light it.
links.polish: „Tak. A potem on jest martwy. Z rozdziawionymi ustami...” – zagląda do jasnozielonej paczki papierosów, wyjmuje z niej kolejnego i przymierza się, żeby go zapalić.
links.belarusian: "Так. А потым ён мёртвы. З распаўз тэм вуснамі..." – зазірае ў светла-зялёную пачку цыгарэт, дастае з яе чарговую і прымяраецца, каб запаліць яе.

links.title: Reaction Speed: "Agape? Ready to catch a bullet? A c..."
links.english: Agape? Ready to catch a bullet? A coincidence? Make a note and return to it later.
links.polish: Rozdziawionymi? Gotowymi na kulę? Czy to przypadek? Zapamiętaj i wróć do tego później.
links.belarusian: Раззявленымі? Гатовымі да кулі? Ці гэта выпадак? Запомні і вярніся да гэтага пазней.

links.title: You: ""How do you see him?""
links.english: "How do you see him?"
