links.polish: „Jak go pani widzi?”
links.belarusian: "Як вы яго бачыце?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""You don't wanna know." She looks i..."
links.english: "You don't wanna know." She looks into the pack -- it's light green -- then pulls out a ciggy.
links.polish: „Nie chce pan wiedzieć” – zagląda do jasnozielonej paczki, z której wyciąga następnie papierosa.
links.belarusian: "Не хочаце ведаць," — зазірае ў светла-зялёную пачку, з якой затым дастае цыгарэту.

links.title: You: ""I see him as *me*.""
links.english: "I see him as *me*."
links.polish: „Widzę go jako *siebie*”.
links.belarusian: "Бачу яго як *себе*".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): "She dips the cigarette in the light..."
links.english: She dips the cigarette in the lighter's flame and inhales, then looks at you -- with her lungs full of smoke.
links.polish: Zanurza papierosa w płomieniu zapalniczki i wdycha dym, po czym spogląda na ciebie z wypełnionymi płucami.
links.belarusian: Апускае цыгарэту ў полымя запальнічкі і ўдыхае дым, пасля чаго глядзіць на цябе з напоўненымі лёгкімі.

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""I can see the similarity, yes." Sh..."
links.english: "I can see the similarity, yes." She breathes out, through her nostrils. The air smells of menthol.
links.polish: „Tak, dostrzegam podobieństwo” – wypuszcza dym przez nozdrza. Powietrze przesycone jest mentolem.
links.belarusian: "Так, я бачу падабенства", — выпускае дым праз ноздры. Паветра насычана ментолам.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Funny," the lieutenant says softly..."
links.english: "Funny," the lieutenant says softly.
links.polish: „Zabawne” – stwierdza porucznik ładnym głosem.
links.belarusian: "Смешна", — адзначыў лейтэнант прыемным голасам.

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Funny how?""
links.english: "Funny how?"
links.polish: „Co w tym zabawnego?”
links.belarusian: "Што ў гэтым смешнага?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Nothing." He nods toward the yard...."
links.english: "Nothing." He nods toward the yard. "I also saw him. We had a long inspection and that sort of thing... sticks with you. Let's move on."
links.polish: „Nic” – odpowiada, wskazując skinieniem głowy dziedziniec. „Też go widziałem. Przeprowadziliśmy szczegółowe oględziny ciała i takie rzeczy... zapadają w pamięć. Kontynuujmy”.
links.belarusian: "Нічога", — адказвае, ківаючы галавой у бок двара. "Я таксама яго бачыў. Мы правялі дэталёвы агляд цела, і такія рэчы... запамінаюцца. Працягваем".

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "In my dream, he thinks, he said I'v..."
links.english: In my dream, he thinks, he said I've failed his children... you glance at the lieutenant. Then back to her.
links.polish: W moim śnie – myśli – powiedział, że zawiodłem jego dzieci... Spoglądasz na porucznika. A potem z powrotem na nią.
links.belarusian: У маім сне – думае – сказаў, што я падвёў яго дзяцей... Глядзіш на лейтэнанта. А потым зноў на яе.

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): "She fishes a cigarette out of her p..."
links.english: She fishes a cigarette out of her pack and lights it -- then looks at you with her lungs full of smoke.
links.polish: Wyławia z paczki papieros i zapala go, po czym – gdy w jej płucach kłębi się mentolowy opar – spogląda na ciebie.
links.belarusian: Выцягвае з пачкі цыгарэту і запальвае яе, пасля чаго – калі ў яе лёгкіх клубіцца ментолавы дым – глядзіць на цябе.

links.title: You: ""Better conclude this part of our t..."
links.english: "Better conclude this part of our talk."
links.polish: „Lepiej zakończmy już tę część rozmowy”.
links.belarusian: "Лепш скончым ужо гэтую частку размовы".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Oh yes." The young woman dips her..."
links.english: "Oh yes." The young woman dips her cigarette into the lighter's flame and inhales.
links.polish: „O tak” – młoda kobieta zanurza papieros w płomieniu zapalniczki i wdycha srebrzystą mgłę.
links.belarusian: "О так", — маладая жанчына апускае цыгарэту ў полымя запальнічкі і ўдыхае срэбнаватае воблака.

links.title: You: "Say nothing."
links.english: Say nothing.
links.polish: Nic nie mów.
links.belarusian: Нічога не кажы.

links.title: Inland Empire: "You *pissed* it all away... All of..."
links.english: You *pissed* it all away... All of it. Elysium.
links.polish: *Przepieprzyłeś* to wszystko... Co do ostatka. Elizjum.
links.belarusian: *Прапярдзеў* гэта ўсё... Да апошняга. Элізіум.

links.title: You: ""What did they hang him for, if not..."
links.english: "What did they hang him for, if not rape?"
links.polish: „Za co go powiesili, skoro nie za gwałt?”
links.belarusian: "За што яго павесілі, калі не за гвалт?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""He had something to do with the st..."
links.english: "He had something to do with the strike. One has been roiling since I got here. Rotten timing..." She thinks. "But you probably know all about it."
links.polish: „Miał coś wspólnego ze strajkiem. Obserwuję, jak wzbiera, odkąd tu jestem. Parszywy moment wybrałam...” – konstatuje. „Ale pan już pewnie to wszystko wie”.
links.belarusian: "Ён меў нешта агульнае са страйкам. Я назіраю, як ён нарошчваецца, з таго часу, як я тут. Я выбрала няўдалы момант..." – канстатуе яна. "Але вы, напэўна, ужо ўсё гэта ведаеце".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""And his role in this strike was......"
links.english: "And his role in this strike was... what?"
links.polish: „Na czym polegała jego rola w tym strajku?”
links.belarusian: "У чым заключалася яго роля ў гэтым страйку?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""I think he was in a security detai..."
links.english: "I think he was in a security detail. He was ex-military. Worked for Wild Pines -- and against the Union. We didn't discuss work much, if you know what I mean. But I understood it was dangerous."
links.polish: „Chyba zajmował się ochroną. To był wojskowy. Pracował dla Wild Pines i przeciwko Związkowi. O pracy zbyt wiele nie rozmawialiśmy, rozumie pan. Wiedziałam tylko, że wykonuje niebezpieczny zawód”.
links.belarusian: "Здаецца, ён займаўся аховай. Гэта быў вайсковы. Працоўны для Wild Pines і супраць Саюзу. Пра працу мы шмат не размаўлялі, разумееце. Я толькі ведала, што ў яго небяспечная прафесія".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""And they lynched him for it?""
links.english: "And they lynched him for it?"
links.polish: „I za to go zlinczowali?”
links.belarusian: "І за гэта яго злінчавалі?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): "She nods."
links.english: She nods.
links.polish: Potakuje.
links.belarusian: Рэха.

links.title: You: ""And his role in this strike was......"
links.english: "And his role in this strike was... what?"
links.polish: „A jego rola w tym strajku to...?”
links.belarusian: "А яго роля ў гэтым страйку гэта...?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""I think he was in a security detai..."
links.english: "I think he was in a security detail. He was ex-military. Worked for Wild Pines; against the Union. We didn't discuss work much, if you know what I mean. But I understood it was dangerous."
links.polish: „Chyba zajmował się ochroną. To był wojskowy. Pracował dla Wild Pines, przeciwko Związkowi. O pracy zbyt wiele nie rozmawialiśmy, rozumie pan. Wiedziałam tylko, że wykonuje niebezpieczny zawód”.
links.belarusian: "Мабыць, ён займаўся аховай. Гэта быў вайсковец. Працоў для Wild Pines, супраць Саюза. Пра працу мы не вельмі шмат размаўлялі, разумееце. Я ведала толькі, што ён займаецца небяспечнай прафесіяй".

links.title: You: ""And you think they lynched him for..."
links.english: "And you think they lynched him for it?"
links.polish: „I myśli pani, że go za to zlinczowali?”
links.belarusian: "І вы думаеце, што яго за гэта зняважылі?"

links.title: You: ""Why was there a bullet in his head?""
links.english: "Why was there a bullet in his head?"
links.polish: „Czemu miał w głowie kulę?”
links.belarusian: "Чаму ў яго была куля ў галаве?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Bullet?" There's a silence. Her br..."
links.english: "Bullet?" There's a silence. Her brows meet in the middle, for a pained frown. "They *shot* him too?"
links.polish: „Kulę?” – pyta, po czym zapada cisza. Jej brwi spotykają się pośrodku w wyrazie dojmującego bólu. „I jeszcze do niego *strzelili*?”
links.belarusian: "Кулю?" — пытаецца яна, пасля чаго надыходзіць цішыня. Яе бровы злучаюцца пасярэдзіне ў выразе вострага болю. "І яшчэ ў яго *стралялі*?"

links.title: Drama: "I'm not picking up any theatre-craf..."
links.english: I'm not picking up any theatre-craft here, sir. The pause is sincere.
links.polish: Nie wykrywam tu żadnej teatralności, szanowny panie. Ta chwila milczenia była szczera.
links.belarusian: Я не выяўляю тут ніякай тэатральнасці, паважаны спадар. Гэты момант маўчання быў шчыры.

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""They stripped his clothes *and* th..."
links.english: "They stripped his clothes *and* they shot him..."
links.polish: „Nie dość, że zerwali z niego ubranie, to *jeszcze* do niego strzelili...”
links.belarusian: "Мала таго, што сарвалі з яго адзенне, дык *яшчэ* і стралялі ў яго..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You mean *after* they hanged him?""
links.english: "You mean *after* they hanged him?"
links.polish: „Chciała pani powiedzieć, że strzelili do niego *po* tym, jak go powiesili?”
links.belarusian: "Вы хацелі сказаць, што стрэлілі ў яго *пасля* таго, як павесілі?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""I'm confused. Sorry.""
links.english: "I'm confused. Sorry."
links.polish: „Przepraszam, jestem skołowana”.
links.belarusian: "Прабачце, я заблыталася".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""So am I. Were you aware that he ha..."
links.english: "So am I. Were you aware that he had also been shot, miss?"
links.polish: „Ja też. Czy wiedziała pani, że został też postrzelony?”
links.belarusian: "Я таксама. А ці ведалі вы, што ён таксама быў паранены стрэлам?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Things are starting to go a little..."
links.english: "Things are starting to go a little over my head here... I thought he was hanged? I was not *present* when they did it. I don't know what happened. I just know what they told me -- and Sylvie, the bartender."
links.polish: „Zaczyna mnie to trochę przerastać... Nie został powieszony? Nie byłam przy tym *obecna*. Nie wiem, co się stało. Tylko tyle, ile dowiedziałam się od barmanki Sylvie i od innych ludzi”.
links.belarusian: "Гэта пачынае мяне крыху перарастаць... Яго ня павесілі? Я не была пры гэтым *прысутная*. Я не ведаю, што здарылася. Толькі тое, што даведалася ад бармэнкі Сільвіі і ад іншых людзей".

links.title: Logic: "This is beginning to get *confusing..."
links.english: This is beginning to get *confusing* for you too and we don't like that. Where was she last Sunday night?
links.polish: Dla ciebie też zaczyna się to robić *niezrozumiałe* i bardzo nam się to nie podoba. Gdzie ona była w ostatnią niedzielę w nocy?
links.belarusian: Для цябе таксама пачынае гэта рабіцца *незразумела* і вельмі нам гэта не падабаецца. Дзе яна была ў мінулую нядзелю ноччу?

links.title: You: ""Where were you when this happened?""
links.english: "Where were you when this happened?"
links.polish: „Gdzie pani była, kiedy to się stało?”
links.belarusian: "Дзе вы былі, калі гэта здарылася?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Cowering. I was cowering downstair..."
links.english: "Cowering. I was cowering downstairs with Sylvie."
links.polish: „Kuliłam się. Na dole, razem z Sylvie”.
links.belarusian: "Я скурчылася. Унізе, разам з Сільві".

links.title: You: "Let it be."
links.english: Let it be.
links.polish: Odpuść.
links.belarusian: Адпусці.

links.title: Logic: "If we're letting things *be* out of..."
links.english: If we're letting things *be* out of courtesy -- why did you even dig the bullet out in the first place? But fine...
links.polish: Jeśli *odpuszczamy* pytania ze względu na grzeczność, to po co w ogóle wyciągałeś tę kulę? Ale jak tam chcesz...
links.belarusian: Калі *пакідаем* пытанні з-за ветлівасці, то навошта ўвогуле даставаў гэтую кулю? Але як табе хочацца...

links.title: Logic: "It's hard to know what to think abo..."
links.english: It's hard to know what to think about that answer.
links.polish: Ciężko stwierdzić, co należy myśleć o tej odpowiedzi.
links.belarusian: Цяжка сказаць, што думаць пра гэты адказ.

links.title: Empathy: "She's just tired. Don't push her to..."
links.english: She's just tired. Don't push her too much.
links.polish: Jest po prostu zmęczona. Nie naciskaj jej zbytnio.
links.belarusian: Яна проста стомленая. Не цісні на яе занадта.

links.title: You: ""You mean *after* they hanged him?""
links.english: "You mean *after* they hanged him?"
links.polish: „Znaczy się, *po* powieszeniu?”
links.belarusian: "Значыць, *пасля* павешання?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""I'm confused. Sorry.""
links.english: "I'm confused. Sorry."
links.polish: „Przepraszam, jestem skołowana”.
links.belarusian: "Прабачце, я заблыталася".

links.title: You: ""Were you aware that he was also sh..."
links.english: "Were you aware that he was also shot, miss? In the mouth?"
links.polish: „Czy wiedziała pani, że został też postrzelony? W usta?”
links.belarusian: "Ці ведалі вы, што яго таксама падстрэлілі? У вусны?"

links.title: You: ""Again -- how do the Hardie boys kn..."
links.english: "Again -- how do the Hardie boys know you?"
links.polish: „Jeszcze raz – skąd zna się pani z chłopakami Hardiego?”
links.belarusian: "Яшчэ раз — адкуль вы ведаеце хлопцаў Хардзі?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Like I said, we met over drinks.""
links.english: "Like I said, we met over drinks."
links.polish: „Już mówiłam. Poznaliśmy się przy barze”.
links.belarusian: "Я ўжо казала. Мы пазнаёміліся каля бара".

links.title: You: ""Did you *party*?""
links.english: "Did you *party*?"
links.polish: „*Imprezowaliście*?”
links.belarusian: "*Весяліліся*?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""A little, yeah.""
links.english: "A little, yeah."
links.polish: „Trochę”.
links.belarusian: "Троху".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Like you partied with the deceased?""
links.english: "Like you partied with the deceased?"
links.polish: „Tak jak imprezowała pani z ofiarą?”
links.belarusian: "Так як вы гулялі з ахвярай?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""No. Not as hard.""
links.english: "No. Not as hard."
links.polish: „Nie. Nie tak ostro”.
links.belarusian: "Не. Не так рэзка".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I'm sorry to have to ask this, but..."
links.english: "I'm sorry to have to ask this, but have you had a physical relationship with any of the Hardie boys?"
links.polish: „Przepraszam, że o to pytam, ale czy utrzymywała pani intymne kontakty z którymś z chłopaków Hardiego?”
links.belarusian: "Прабачце, што я пытаю, але ці падтрымлівалі вы інтымныя адносіны з кімсьці з хлопцаў Хардзі?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""I have.""
links.english: "I have."
links.polish: „Owszem”.
links.belarusian: "Вядома".

links.title: You: ""Which one?""
links.english: "Which one?"
links.polish: „Z którym?”
links.belarusian: "З якім?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Which *ones*, sir -- I don't remem..."
links.english: "Which *ones*, sir -- I don't remember precisely. Titus, obviously. But as I said, it's been a long winter."
links.polish: „Z *którymi*, ma pan na myśli. Nie pamiętam dokładnie. Z Titusem, oczywiście. Ale tak jak mówiłam, to była długa zima”.
links.belarusian: "З *якімі* вы маеце на ўвазе. Я дакладна не памятаю. З Цітусам, вядома. Але, як я ўжо казала, гэта была доўгая зіма".

links.title: Suggestion: "Could that have been part of the re..."
links.english: Could that have been part of the reason they hanged him?
links.polish: Czy to mógł być jeden z powodów, dla których go powiesili?
links.belarusian: Ці магло гэта быць адной з прычын, па якіх яго павесілі?

links.title: You: ""Could that be why they lynched him..."
links.english: "Could that be why they lynched him? Jealousy?"
links.polish: „Czy to może być powód, dla którego go zlinczowali? Przez zazdrość?”
links.belarusian: "Ці можа гэта быць прычынай, па якой яго лінчавалі? З-за рэўнасці?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""I hope not." A pause. "Actually, I..."
links.english: "I hope not." A pause. "Actually, I *know* that's not the reason. I'm careful about that kind of thing. Not crossing the wires, you know. But that's probably where they got the rape idea."
links.polish: „Mam nadzieję, że nie” – milknie na chwilę. „Właściwie to *wiem* na pewno, że nie taki był powód. Jestem w tym względzie ostrożna. Unikam prowokowania konfliktów. Ale pewnie stąd ten cały pomysł z gwałtem”.
links.belarusian: "Спадзяюся, што не", — на імгненне замоўк. "Уласна кажучы, я *ведаю* дакладна, што не гэта была прычына. У гэтым плане я асцярожная. Пазбягаю правакавання канфліктаў. Але, мабыць, адсюль і ўвесь гэты план з гвалтам".

links.title: You: ""What do you mean?""
links.english: "What do you mean?"
links.polish: „Co chce pani przez to powiedzieć?”
links.belarusian: "Што вы хочаце гэтым сказаць?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Men like that? I don't know..." An..."
links.english: "Men like that? I don't know..." Another pause. "It's the way their imaginations work. I suspect it's what they'd like to do to me."
links.polish: „Że mężczyźni to lubią? Nie wiem...” – kolejna pauza. „Tak działa ich wyobraźnia. Pewnie to właśnie chcieliby ze mną zrobić”.
links.belarusian: "Што мужчыны гэта любяць? Не ведаю..." — яшчэ адна паўза. "Так працуе іх уяўленне. Напэўна, вось якраз гэта яны хацелі б са мной зрабіць".

links.title: Electrochemistry: "She changes balance from one foot t..."
links.english: She changes balance from one foot to another, crossing her legs.
links.polish: Przenosi ciężar z jednej stopy na drugą. Krzyżuje nogi.
links.belarusian: Пераносіць вагу з адной нагі на другую. Крыжуе ногі.

links.title: You: "Don't mention it."
links.english: Don't mention it.
links.polish: Nie wspominaj o tym.
links.belarusian: Не згадвай пра гэта.

links.title: Suggestion: "Don't be tactful. She doesn't care."
links.english: Don't be tactful. She doesn't care.
links.polish: Nie sil się na takt. Ona ma to w nosie.
links.belarusian: Не напружвайся з тактам. Яе гэта не цікавіць.

links.title: You: ""Understood.""
links.english: "Understood."
links.polish: „Rozumiem”.
links.belarusian: "Разумею".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): "She sips her coffee. Birds circle o..."
links.english: She sips her coffee. Birds circle overhead.
links.polish: Sączy swoją kawę. Nad waszymi głowami krążą ptaki.
links.belarusian: Цадзіць сваю каву. Над вашымі галовамі кружляюць птушкі.

links.title: You: ""Um, how should I put this...""
links.english: "Um, how should I put this..."
links.polish: „Hm, jak to ująć...”
links.belarusian: "Хм, як гэта сказаць..."

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Have I slept with any of them? Yes.""
links.english: "Have I slept with any of them? Yes."
links.polish: „Czy z nimi spałam? Tak”.
links.belarusian: "Ці спала я з імі? Так".

links.title: You: ""But have you had sexual relations..."
links.english: "But have you had sexual relations with any of the Hardie boys?"
links.polish: „Ale czy utrzymywała pani intymne kontakty z którymś z chłopaków Hardiego?”
links.belarusian: "Але ці падтрымлівалі вы інтымныя адносіны з кім-небудзь з хлопцаў Хардзі?"

links.title: You: ""A little? Like you partied with th..."
links.english: "A little? Like you partied with the deceased?"
links.polish: „Trochę? Tak jak imprezowała pani z ofiarą?”
links.belarusian: "Трохі? Так, як вы весяліліся з ахвярай?"

links.title: Logic: "There *must* be more to it. You sho..."
links.english: There *must* be more to it. You should return to this topic after you've talked about her relationship with the deceased, maybe?
links.polish: *Musi* się za tym kryć coś więcej. Może powinieneś wrócić do tego tematu, jak już porozmawiasz z nią o jej relacjach z denatem?
links.belarusian: *Мусіць,* за гэтым хаваецца нешта большае. Магчыма, табе варта вярнуцца да гэтай тэмы, як толькі паразмаўляеш з ёй пра яе адносіны з памерлым?

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""They're frequent guests. Downstair..."
links.english: "They're frequent guests. Downstairs." She looks at the floor. It's tarred. "They have a booth for Union members. They're probably down there now."
links.polish: „Często tu goszczą. Na dole” – przenosi wzrok na podłogę, brudną od smoły. „Jest tam wydzielone miejsce dla związkowców. Pewnie i teraz można ich tam znaleźć”.
links.belarusian: "Часта тут бываюць. Унізе" — пераносіць позірк на падлогу, брудную ад смалы. "Там ёсць адведзенае месца для прафсаюзнікаў. Пэўна, і зараз можна іх там знайсці".

links.title: You: ""And how did you meet?""
links.english: "And how did you meet?"
links.polish: „A jak się poznaliście?”
links.belarusian: "А як вы пазнаёміліся?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""Over drinks. It's been a long, bor..."
links.english: "Over drinks. It's been a long, boring winter."
links.polish: „Przy barze. To była długa i nudna zima”.
links.belarusian: "Ля бара. Гэта была доўгая і сумная зіма".

links.title: You: ""How do the Hardie boys know you?""
links.english: "How do the Hardie boys know you?"
links.polish: „Skąd zna się pani z chłopakami Hardiego?”
links.belarusian: "Адкуль вы ведаеце хлопцаў Хардынга?"

Alternate1.english: "Again -- how do the Hardie boys know you?"
Alternate1.polish: „Jeszcze raz – skąd zna się pani z chłopakami Hardiego?”
Alternate1.belarusian: "Яшчэ раз – адкуль вы ведаеце хлопцаў Хардзі?"

links.title: You: ""Thank you for telling us all of th..."
links.english: "Thank you for telling us all of this, miss." (Conclude.)
links.polish: „Dziękuję, że nam pani to wszystko powiedziała”. (Zakończ).
links.belarusian: "Дзякуй, што вы нам гэта ўсё расказалі". (Скончыць).

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""How about we, you know, change the..."
links.english: "How about we, you know, change the subject to something more light-hearted now?"
links.polish: „Jest szansa na przejście do jakiegoś lżejszego tematu?”
links.belarusian: "Ці ёсць шанец перайсці да нейкай лягчэйшай тэмы?"

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): "She breathes a silvery sigh of reli..."
links.english: She breathes a silvery sigh of relief. And weariness. The air on the roof feels humid.
links.polish: Wypuszcza z ust srebrzystą mgiełkę i jest w tym westchnieniu ulga, ale też zmęczenie. Powietrze na dachu przesiąknięte jest wilgocią.
links.belarusian: Выпускае з вуснаў срэбрыстую імглу, і ў гэтым уздыху палёгка, але таксама стомленасць. Паветра на даху прасякнута вільгаццю.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Should we head back downstairs, of..."
links.english: "Should we head back downstairs, officer?" The lieutenant looks at you. "We may have things to discuss there."
links.polish: „Zejdziemy na dół, oficerze?” – pyta porucznik, spoglądając na ciebie. „Zdaje się, że mamy kilka rzeczy do omówienia”.
links.belarusian: "Спусцімся ўніз, афіцэр?" – пытаецца лейтэнант, гледзячы на цябе. "Здаецца, мы маем некалькі рэчаў для абмеркавання".

links.title: You: ""I had something else. Before we go..."
links.english: "I had something else. Before we go. A little thing."
links.polish: „Mam jeszcze jedną sprawę. Zanim pójdziemy. Drobiazg”.
links.belarusian: "У мяне ёсць яшчэ адна справа. Перад тым, як пойдзем. Дробязь".

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): "She nods. Silvery cigarette fumes d..."
links.english: She nods. Silvery cigarette fumes disappear into her mouth...
links.polish: Kiwa głową. Srebrzysty papierosowy opar znika w jej ustach...
links.belarusian: Ківае галавой. Срэбрысты цыгарэтны дым знікае ў яе вуснах...

links.title: You: ""Let's go." [Leave.]"
links.english: "Let's go." [Leave.]
links.polish: „Chodźmy”. [Odejdź].
links.belarusian: "Пойдзем". [Адыдзі].

links.title: Inland Empire: "As he says so you feel the young wo..."
links.english: As he says so you feel the young woman looking at you... and get a *feeling* you can't quite put your finger on. A suspicion?
links.polish: Kiedy to mówi, czujesz na sobie wzrok młodej kobiety... i ogarnia cię *uczucie*, którego nie umiesz do końca nazwać. Jakieś podejrzenie?
links.belarusian: Калі ён гэта кажа, вы адчуваеце на сабе позірк маладой жанчыны... і ахоплівае вас *адчуванне*, якое вы не можаце цалкам назваць. Якія-небудзь падазрэнні?

links.title: Reaction Speed: "Wait a moment..."
links.english: Wait a moment...
links.polish: Zaraz, chwilka...
links.belarusian: Зараз, хвілінку...

links.title: Klaasje (Miss Oranje Disco Dancer): ""I hope I've been... you know... he..."
links.english: "I hope I've been... you know... helpful. All things considered."
links.polish: „Mam nadzieję, że byłam... no wie pan... pomocna. Mimo wszystko”.
links.belarusian: "Спадзяюся, што я была... ну, ведаеце... карыснай. Нягледзячы на ўсё".

links.title: Inland Empire: "As she says so you feel the young w..."
links.english: As she says so you feel the young woman looking at you... and get a *feeling* you can't quite put your finger on. A suspicion?
links.polish: Kiedy to mówi, czujesz na sobie jej wzrok... i ogarnia cię *uczucie*, którego nie umiesz do końca nazwać. Jakieś podejrzenie?
links.belarusian: Калі яна гэта кажа, ты адчуваеш на сабе яе позірк... і ахоплівае цябе *адчуванне*, якое ты не можаш да канца назваць. Якое падазрэнне?

links.title: Reaction Speed: "Wait a moment..."
links.english: Wait a moment...
links.polish: Zaraz, chwilka...
links.belarusian: Пачакай, трошкі...

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I'm sorry, but we're not quite don..."
links.english: "I'm sorry, but we're not quite done here yet." He turns to you... "We have more questions. Better to be thorough now than have to come back to this later."
links.polish: „Przepraszam, ale jeszcze nie skończyliśmy” – stwierdza porucznik i zwraca się do ciebie: „Mamy więcej pytań. Lepiej zadać je teraz, niż wracać do nich później”.
links.belarusian: "Прабачце, але мы яшчэ не скончылі", — заяўляе лейтэнант і звяртаецца да вас: "У нас ёсць больш пытанняў. Лепш задаць іх зараз, чым вяртацца да іх пазней".

links.title: Empathy: "You get the feeling she might be."
links.english: You get the feeling she might be.
links.polish: Masz przeczucie, że mogłaby się tak zachowywać.
links.belarusian: У вас ёсць прадчуванне, што яна магла б так паводзіць сябе.

dialogueTree.title: Volition: "She looks back, time moves slowly...."
dialogueTree.english: She looks back, time moves slowly. The triangles of her face rearranging into a weary smile...
dialogueTree.polish: Odpowiada ci spojrzeniem. Czas upływa powoli. Na jej trójkątnej twarzy pojawia się zmęczony uśmiech...
dialogueTree.belarusian: Адказвае табе позіркам. Час плыве павольна. На яе трохвугольным твары з'яўляецца стомленая ўсмешка...
